jobs.title: Behavior Technician – ABA Practicum Opportunity - Wildwood, MO
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location: Wildwood, MO

Setting: In-home

Schedule: Monday to Friday, 4:00 - 6:30pm

Pay: $18-$23/hour

As a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT), you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing ABA care. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a school setting

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Be available weekly for supervision by the Behavior Analyst

  • Attend team meetings

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Sick Days for full-time clinical staff

What You'll Need

  • Currently enrolled in a practicum or fieldwork program related to Applied Behavior Analysis, psychology, education, or a similar field (required)

  • Obtain Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certification within 60 days of hire

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Must have an active CPR Certification

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are At Finni Health

Finni Health empowers BCBAs to launch local in-home ABA practices. We are bringing together world-class therapists, marketers and technology enthusiasts to build the future of autism care. Help join us change the modality of care together!

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance

  • Health insurance

  • Mileage reimbursement

  • Paid time off

  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Day shift, Evening Shift

  • Monday to Friday

License/Certification:

  • CPR Certification (Required)

Work Location: On-site, In-School, In-Home

jobs.title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) - Denver, CO
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Finni is looking for a Full-time BT/RBT!

As a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing ABA care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting and community

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Be available weekly for supervision by the Behavior Analyst

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Sick Days

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

jobs.title: Part-Time Behavior Technician (RBT) - Lafayette, GA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Part-Time Behavior Technician (RBT) — Lafayette, GA


Finni Health is seeking a dedicated and compassionate part-time Behavior Technician (BT/RBT) to join our team! As an RBT, you will collaborate with our Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) to provide life-changing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) care to children in their home and community settings. In this role, you will work directly with families, supporting children in developing new skills and achieving important milestones.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Deliver in-person behavioral intervention services in the child's home and community

  • Accurately collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Participate in weekly supervision with a Behavior Analyst

  • Attend team meetings and collaborate with other professionals


What We Offer:

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Flexible hours & opportunities for career growth

  • PTO and sick days

  • Mileage reimbursement


Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or equivalent required (ideal for those pursuing a career in the field)

  • Experience working with children, especially those with special needs, is preferred

  • Reliable transportation

  • Active CPR certification required

  • Willingness to become RBT certified within a specified timeframe


Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Capability to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods

  • Comfort with sitting on the floor or standing for long periods


Who We Are:
Finni Health empowers BCBAs to launch local in-home ABA clinics. Our team includes world-class therapists, marketers, and technology enthusiasts working together to build the future of autism care. Join us as we innovate and improve care for children and their families!


Job Details:

  • Job Type: Part-time

  • Pay: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

  • Schedule: Monday to Friday

  • Work Location: In-person


Benefits:

  • Dental insurance

  • Health insurance

  • Vision insurance

  • Paid time off


License/Certification:

  • CPR Certification (Required)

  • RBT Certification (Preferred)


#FinniHealth2025


All offers of employment are conditional upon the successful completion of a background check to ensure the safety of our clients and their families.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Setting: Clinic, in-home
Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5:30pm (full-time and part-time available)
Pay: $18-22/hour for direct client contact work, $13/hour for indirect work

As a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT), you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing ABA care. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

jobs.title: Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician/Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) – Part-Time
Location: Wallingford, CT
Compensation: $21 - $27/hour
Hours: up to 20 hours per week (Possible FT opportunity with 2nd client in East Haven)
Schedule: M-F

Position Overview

Arc Light Behavioral Health Collective (www.arclightbhc.com) is a small BCBA-owned company seeking a dedicated and compassionate Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) to provide in-home Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to clients in Wallingford, CT. This role involves working one-on-one with children and adolescents diagnosed with autism and other developmental disabilities, implementing behavior intervention plans, and supporting skill development under the supervision of a Board-Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA). We pride ourselves on our approach to treatment that centers around the individual and supports the family.

Our company exceeds supervision requirements for RBTs and offers BCBA candidate supervision, specializing in unrestricted hours, as an employment benefit. We feel that the collaboration between the BCBAs and those we supervise is what makes our company special. If you are interested in individualized or group supervision, or in speaking with our current supervisees, please reach out.

Essential Functions

  • Implement individualized ABA treatment plans for children and adolescents in a home setting under the guidance of a BCBA

  • Support behavior management strategies, ensuring consistency and adherence to treatment plans

  • Supervise community outings and run objectives in real- world settings

  • Assist in creating client materials to support intervention goals

  • Provide parent training and collaborate with families to reinforce learning and progress

  • Maintain accurate data collection and timely documentation of clinical services

  • Work with clients who have a history of aggression and elopement (though rarely engage in it) and demonstrate confidence in managing challenging behaviors

  • Maintain a reliable and consistent schedule with families to ensure effective therapy implementation

  • Follow BACB ethical guidelines and company policies

  • Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications & Requirements

  • Active RBT certification (preferred)

  • Minimum one year of experience working with children or adolescents with developmental disabilities, behavioral challenges, or related fields

  • Strong time management skills and ability to manage a caseload efficiently

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • High level of organization, attention to detail, and professionalism

  • Passion for helping children and adolescents reach their full potential

  • Ability to work independently in-home with minimal supervision

Competencies

  • Accuracy – Consistently records and calculates data correctly

  • Customer Service – Provides quality service, responds to feedback, and meets commitments

  • Organization – Maintains effective time management and use of resources

  • Learning Orientation – Demonstrates willingness to grow professionally and stay up to date on ABA best practices

  • Flexibility – Adapts to changing client needs and schedules

  • Ethical Conduct – Upholds company and BACB ethical standards

  • Problem Solving – Uses critical thinking to address client needs effectively

  • Collaboration – Works well with families, supervisors, and other team members

  • Communication – Clearly communicates with clients, families, and colleagues

Work Environment & Physical Demands

  • This job operates in a client home environment – employees must be comfortable working in various home settings

  • Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs, bend, stoop, reach, and move comfortably in client homes

Employment Terms

  • Position with a flexible schedule based on client needs

  • Employment is at-will, and responsibilities may change as needed

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $21.00 - $27.00 per hour - we believe in pay transparency

Expected hours: 20 per week

Benefits:

  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

  • Evening shift

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

As a Behavior Technician (BT) you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing ABA care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

 - Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting and community

 - Collect and record data on child behaviors

 - Be available weekly for supervision by the Behavior Analyst

 - Attend team meetings

What We Offer

 - Competitive pay and paid training

 - Career Growth & flexible hours

 - PTO and Sick Days

 - Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

 - Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within the field

 - Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

 - Reliable Transportation

 - To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Physical Requirements

 - Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

 - Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

 - Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are At Finni Health

Finni Health empowers BCBAs to launch local in-home ABA clinics. We are bringing together world-class therapists, marketers and technology enthusiasts to build the future of autism care. Help join us change the modality of care together!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $30.00 per hour

Benefits:

 - Dental insurance

 - Health insurance

 - Paid time off

 - Vision insurance

Application Question(s):

 - Are you located within a 30 minute commute of Alden, New York?

 - Do you have at least one year of childcare experience?

License/Certification:

 - CPR Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: ABA Behavior Technician
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Part-Time Behavior Technician (In-Home ABA) — Saginaw, MI

Company: Finni Health of Central Michigan (a Finni Health Practice)
Schedule: Monday–Friday, 10:00 AM – 3:00 PM
Job Type: Part-time
Location: In-home services, Saginaw, MI

Make a Meaningful Impact

Are you passionate about helping children with autism thrive? Join the Finni Health team and become a vital part of a child’s growth journey. We’re hiring Behavior Technicians to provide in-home ABA therapy in the Saginaw area.

This is more than a job — it’s a chance to change lives while growing your career in a supportive, family-focused environment.

What You’ll Do

As a Behavior Technician, you’ll work 1:1 with children in their home under the guidance of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA). You will:

  • Deliver personalized behavior intervention services

  • Support children in learning daily living, communication, and social skills

  • Collect and document behavior data accurately

  • Collaborate with your clinical team and attend regular team meetings

  • Help implement and refine treatment plans tailored to each child’s needs

What We’re Looking For

  • Education: High school diploma or equivalent required

  • Experience: 1+ year of ABA experience preferred, or experience working with children (especially those with special needs)

  • Passion: A strong desire to work with children and make a positive impact

  • Training: Completion of a 40-hour RBT course (preferred but not required — we can help you get there!)

  • Certification: Must pass the RBT exam within 90 days of hire (we provide support)

  • Other Requirements:

    • Reliable transportation

    • Background check

      • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

Physical Requirements

  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs

  • Ability to sit, stand, kneel, squat, or crawl for extended periods

  • Comfortable working on the floor and actively engaging with children

What We Offer

  • Competitive Pay: $17.00 – $22.00 per hour (based on experience)

  • Paid Training & Professional Development

  • Flexible Scheduling (ideal for students or those seeking consistent part-time work)

  • Paid Time Off & Mental Health Days

  • Mileage Reimbursement

  • Referral Program

  • Career advancement opportunities within Finni Health

Why Finni Health?

At Finni Health, we believe therapy should be fun, engaging, and tailored to each child. Our therapists use creative, play-based approaches to keep sessions exciting and impactful. We work closely with families to celebrate every milestone and create personalized plans for lasting growth.

When you join Finni Health, you're not just starting a job — you're joining a mission-driven team that's passionate about helping children thrive.

Apply today and start making a difference in Saginaw!
We can’t wait to meet you.

jobs.title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Clarksville Autism Center is seeking a dedicated and compassionate Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to join our growing team!


We are a clinician-owned and operated company committed to providing high-quality, ethical ABA services for children with autism and developmental differences. As a BCBA with us, you’ll enjoy clinical freedom—with no caseload size requirements, flexible scheduling, and strong support from a team that truly understands the work you do. This position offers a flexible schedule, competitive pay, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact in the lives of children and their families.

Position: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)

Job Type: Full-time or Part-time available
Pay: $45.00 - $60.00 per hour (Hourly or Salary options for full-time employees)
Expected Hours: Flexible based on candidate availability (Monday – Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:30 PM)
Work Location: In-home and school settings in Clarksville and Fort Campbell

Responsibilities

  • Conduct assessments and develop individualized behavior intervention plans.

  • Supervise and train Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) implementing ABA programs.

  • Monitor client progress and adjust treatment goals and strategies as needed.

  • Maintain accurate and timely documentation in compliance with HIPAA and company standards.

  • Collaborate with families, caregivers, and multidisciplinary teams to ensure consistency and effectiveness of interventions.

  • Provide parent training and ongoing support.

  • Ensure ethical, evidence-based practice in line with BACB guidelines.

Experience & Requirements

  • Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification required.

  • Tennessee Licensed Behavior Analyst (LBA) required.

  • Experience working with children with autism or developmental disabilities.

  • Familiarity with ABA principles and data-driven decision making.

  • Strong communication, organizational, and leadership skills.

  • Experience with high-aggression youth preferred; willingness to work with this population is a must.

  • Required Training: CPR Certification, HIPAA Compliance Training

  • Reliable transportation to and from client locations in Clarksville and Fort Campbell.

Benefits

  • Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance (Full-time employees)

  • 401(k) Retirement Plan (Full-time employees)

  • Paid Time Off

    • Accrual-based vacation

    • Sick pay

    • Paid holidays

  • Short-Term Disability Insurance (Full-time employees)

    • 60% salary replacement for qualifying illnesses, injuries, or maternity leave

  • Mileage Reimbursement

  • Reinforcement Budget for professional development or therapeutic supplies

  • Company-Provided iPad for data collection and session management

Schedule

  • Monday to Friday

  • Flexible hours depending on full-time or part-time status

Location Requirements

  • Must be able to commute to Clarksville, TN 37043, and Fort Campbell areas.

Join our passionate team and help shape brighter futures through meaningful ABA services. We're looking to hire ASAP—apply today and be a part of our mission to support children and families in need.


Clarksville Autism Center is an equal opportunity employer.

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Start your ABA practice with Finni! (BCBAs)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Job Description

We built Finni Health with a passion for empowering BCBAs to start their own practice. We are searching for new practice owners who want to join us in democratizing access to autism care.

We recognize that BCBAs have been taken advantage of by clinics for so long, and there needs to be a solution to help them fulfill their passion for ABA. Our vision is that by mixing the best software with world-class providers, we will create an all-in-one solution to support every BCBA who wants to deliver meticulous care to families.

We're seeking a provider to help them build their behavioral therapy practice. The practice can be focussed on a local market or service remote clients in other states. As a practice owner, you will work with us to set up your own practice from the ground up and help us set the foundation for empowering all BCBAs nationwide!

Learn more here: https://www.finnihealth.com/providers


What the role entails!

  • Collaborate with our team on setting up guidelines, handbooks, and processes for your own practice.

  • Communicate with our team on billing and insurance to meet payor requirements and submission deadlines.

  • Provide field and virtual supervision for Behavior Technicians.

  • Monitor the effectiveness of the treatment approach and modify the program as needed.

  • Conduct functional assessments and complete assessment and progress reports accordingly.

  • Design and deliver behavior intervention plan implementation, training, and other related in-service programs, including client-specific intervention training to staff and parents.

  • Ensure all treatment methodologies are evidence-based and reflect the most recent research findings.

  • Trains and supervises clinical staff by monitoring and providing feedback to staff for the direct implementation of ABA interventions

  • Collaborate with families in the development of behavior support strategies.


Qualifications

  • Master's Degree in Applied Behavioral Analysis, Special Ed, Psychology, or Related Field

  • Valid BCBA Certification.

  • Applicable licensure to practice within the state hired.

  • Minimum three years experience in ABA, with supervisory roles preferred.

  • Strong leadership skills.

  • Strong oral and written communication skills.


Why work with us?

We solve every problem a BCBA would face when starting a practice, such that BCBAs can pursue their dream without risk.

  • You get to change an industry!

  • We lead with empathy - families come first.

  • We believe in the highest standard of care - we will not overwork or extend your caseload.

  • Happy providers are the backbone of healthcare.

  • We will invest in & provide an extensive curriculum, continuous training, supervision, & mentorship for teammates to ensure the highest level of clinical treatment is offered to clients.

Benefits:

  • 401(k)

  • Continuing education credits

  • Dental insurance

  • Flexible schedule

  • Health insurance

  • Paid time off

  • Parental leave

  • Professional development assistance

  • Referral program

  • Vision insurance


Compensation Package:

  • Bonus opportunities


Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday


License/Certification:

  • BCBA (Required)


Work Location: Remote

#FinniHealth

#FinniHealth

jobs.title: Start your ABA practice in New Mexico! (BCBAs)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Job Description

We built Finni Health with a passion for empowering BCBAs to start their own practice. We are searching for new practice owners who want to join us in democratizing access to autism care.

We recognize that BCBAs have been taken advantage of by clinics for so long, and there needs to be a solution to help them fulfill their passion for ABA. Our vision is that by mixing the best software with world-class providers, we will create an all-in-one solution to support every BCBA who wants to deliver meticulous care to families.

We're seeking a provider to help them build their behavioral therapy practice. The practice can be focussed on a local market or service remote clients in other states. As a practice owner, you will work with us to set up your own practice from the ground up and help us set the foundation for empowering all BCBAs nationwide!

Learn more here: https://www.finnihealth.com/providers


What the role entails!

  • Collaborate with our team on setting up guidelines, handbooks, and processes for your own practice.

  • Communicate with our team on billing and insurance to meet payor requirements and submission deadlines.

  • Provide field and virtual supervision for Behavior Technicians.

  • Monitor the effectiveness of the treatment approach and modify the program as needed.

  • Conduct functional assessments and complete assessment and progress reports accordingly.

  • Design and deliver behavior intervention plan implementation, training, and other related in-service programs, including client-specific intervention training to staff and parents.

  • Ensure all treatment methodologies are evidence-based and reflect the most recent research findings.

  • Trains and supervises clinical staff by monitoring and providing feedback to staff for the direct implementation of ABA interventions

  • Collaborate with families in the development of behavior support strategies.


Qualifications

  • Master's Degree in Applied Behavioral Analysis, Special Ed, Psychology, or Related Field

  • Valid BCBA Certification.

  • Applicable licensure to practice within the state hired.

  • Minimum three years experience in ABA, with supervisory roles preferred.

  • Strong leadership skills.

  • Strong oral and written communication skills.


Why work with us?

We solve every problem a BCBA would face when starting a practice, such that BCBAs can pursue their dream without risk.

  • You get to change an industry!

  • We lead with empathy - families come first.

  • We believe in the highest standard of care - we will not overwork or extend your caseload.

  • Happy providers are the backbone of healthcare.

  • We will invest in & provide an extensive curriculum, continuous training, supervision, & mentorship for teammates to ensure the highest level of clinical treatment is offered to clients.

Benefits:

  • 401(k)

  • Continuing education credits

  • Dental insurance

  • Flexible schedule

  • Health insurance

  • Paid time off

  • Parental leave

  • Professional development assistance

  • Referral program

  • Vision insurance


Compensation Package:

  • Bonus opportunities


Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday


License/Certification:

  • BCBA (Required)


Work Location: New Mexico

We solve every problem a BCBA would face when starting a practice, such that BCBAs can pursue their dream without risk.

  • You get to change an industry!

  • We lead with empathy - families come first.

  • We believe in the highest standard of care - we will not overwork or extend your caseload.

  • Happy providers are the backbone of healthcare.

Benefits:

  • Professional development assistance

JOB DESCRIPTION

We built Finni Health with a passion for empowering BCBAs to start their own practice. We are searching for new practice owners who want to join us in democratizing access to autism care.

We recognize that BCBAs have been taken advantage of by clinics for so long, and there needs to be a solution to help them fulfill their passion for ABA. Our vision is that by mixing the best software with world-class providers, we will create an all-in-one solution to support every BCBA who wants to deliver meticulous care to families.

We're seeking a provider to help them build their behavioral therapy practice. The practice can be focussed on a local market or service remote clients in other states. As a practice owner, you will work with us to set up your own practice from the ground up and help us set the foundation for empowering all BCBAs nationwide!

Learn more here: https://www.finnihealth.com/providers


What the role entails!

 - Collaborate with our team on setting up guidelines, handbooks, and processes for your own practice.

 - Communicate with our team on billing and insurance to meet payor requirements and submission deadlines.

 - Provide field and virtual supervision for Behavior Technicians.

 - Monitor the effectiveness of the treatment approach and modify the program as needed.

 - Conduct functional assessments and complete assessment and progress reports accordingly.

 - Design and deliver behavior intervention plan implementation, training, and other related in-service programs, including client-specific intervention training to staff and parents.

 - Ensure all treatment methodologies are evidence-based and reflect the most recent research findings.

 - Trains and supervises clinical staff by monitoring and providing feedback to staff for the direct implementation of ABA interventions

 - Collaborate with families in the development of behavior support strategies.


Qualifications

 - Master's Degree in Applied Behavioral Analysis, Special Ed, Psychology, or Related Field

 - Valid BCBA Certification.

 - Applicable licensure to practice within the state hired.

jobs.title: Founding BCBA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Become a Practice Owner with Finni Health — and Join the Future of Autism Care

At Finni Health, we're on a mission to empower BCBAs to take control of their careers and build independent practices — without the red tape, risk, or burnout of traditional clinics. We’ve created an all-in-one support system that gives you the infrastructure, training, and tools to launch your own practice with confidence.

Our model is proven: a Finni practice owner has the ability to earn over $1m annually, with the flexibility to serve local or remote clients, set your own hours, and scale your impact on your terms.

We built Finni to fix what’s broken. Too many BCBAs feel overworked, underpaid, and undervalued. We believe it's time to flip the script — putting power back in the hands of the provider and ensuring families get the high-quality care they deserve.

If you're a BCBA with a passion for autonomy, clinical excellence, and changing the ABA industry for the better, we want to partner with you.

📌 Learn more: finnihealth.com/providers

What You'll Do

  • Launch and lead your own ABA practice with full operational support from Finni.

  • Help define the clinical standards, policies, and workflows for your team.

  • Deliver and oversee ABA therapy and behavior intervention programs.

  • Provide supervision to Behavior Technicians (BTs) both in the field and virtually.

  • Conduct functional behavior assessments and produce detailed progress reports.

  • Collaborate directly with families to develop and implement behavior support strategies.

  • Ensure all treatment plans reflect evidence-based best practices.

  • Train and coach clinical staff in ABA methodology and ethical practice.

What We’re Looking For

  • Master’s degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Special Education, Psychology, or a related field

  • Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification (required)

  • State licensure (if applicable)

  • 3+ years of ABA experience, ideally with leadership or supervisory background

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Passion for clinical integrity, innovation, and family-centered care

Why Join Finni?

  • Proven income potential — you have the potential to earn over $1m annually.

  • You own your practice — we support everything else

  • Total flexibility: build locally or serve clients remotely

  • Hands-on support for credentialing, billing, recruiting, and compliance

  • Training, mentorship, and clinical infrastructure that lets you grow without burnout

  • A mission-driven team that leads with empathy and puts families first

Benefits

  • Flexible schedule

  • 401(k)

  • Paid time off & parental leave

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance

  • Continuing education credits & professional development

  • Referral bonuses

Work Location: Remote
Schedule: Monday to Friday
Compensation: Base earnings + performance bonuses
Certification: BCBA (Required)

jobs.title: Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician (Full-Time) – Ontario, OH
Hours:

  • Monday - Friday: 12pm-7:30pm

SparkJoy ABA, in partnership with Finni Health, is seeking a compassionate and motivated Behavior Technician to provide in-home and clinic-based ABA therapy to children with autism in Ontario, OH.

Why Join Us?
We’re a mission-driven, clinician-led company focused on ethical care and meaningful outcomes—not investor pressure. Enjoy free advanced training, ongoing BCBA support, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact.

Your Role:

  • Work 1:1 with children in-home using individualized ABA treatment plans

  • Teach communication, daily living, and social skills

  • Collect data and collaborate with supervising BCBAs

  • Support families through parent training and consistent communication

  • Work Environment - This job operates in a client's home environment. Employees must feel comfortable going into client homes and neighborhoods within the assigned territory.

What You Bring:

  • 1+ year experience with children with autism or developmental disabilities

  • Strong communication, time management, and organizational skills

  • A passion for helping children grow and succeed

  • Reliable transportation to client homes in Wadsworth

Job Details:

  • Part-time: 30+ hours/week

  • Pay: $17–$22/hr

  • Benefits: PTO, professional development

Join a company that values people over profit. SparkJoy ABA is changing lives—one session at a time.

Apply today and spark joy in a child’s life.

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician/Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) – Part-Time
Location: Cheshire, CT
Compensation: $21 - $27/hour
Hours: ~10 hours per week
Schedule: roughly between the hours of 3pm-8pm MTuF, 5pm-8pm W, 4pm-8pm Thurs, or open availability on Sat/Sun

Position Overview

Arc Light Behavioral Health Collective (www.arclightbhc.com) is a small BCBA-owned company seeking a dedicated and compassionate Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) to provide in-home Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to clients in Waterbury, CT. This role involves working one-on-one with children and adolescents diagnosed with autism and other developmental disabilities, implementing behavior intervention plans, and supporting skill development under the supervision of a Board-Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA). We pride ourselves on our approach to treatment that centers around the individual and supports the family.

Our company exceeds supervision requirements for RBTs and offers BCBA candidate supervision, specializing in unrestricted hours, as an employment benefit. We feel that the collaboration between the BCBAs and those we supervise is what makes our company special. If you are interested in individualized or group supervision, or in speaking with our current supervisees, please reach out.

Essential Functions

  • Implement individualized ABA treatment plans for children and adolescents in a home setting under the guidance of a BCBA

  • Support behavior management strategies, ensuring consistency and adherence to treatment plans

  • Supervise community outings and run objectives in real- world settings

  • Assist in creating client materials to support intervention goals

  • Provide parent training and collaborate with families to reinforce learning and progress

  • Maintain accurate data collection and timely documentation of clinical services

  • Work with clients who have a history of aggression and elopement (though rarely engage in it) and demonstrate confidence in managing challenging behaviors

  • Maintain a reliable and consistent schedule with families to ensure effective therapy implementation

  • Follow BACB ethical guidelines and company policies

  • Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications & Requirements

  • Active RBT certification (preferred)

  • Minimum one year of experience working with children or adolescents with developmental disabilities, behavioral challenges, or related fields

  • Strong time management skills and ability to manage a caseload efficiently

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • High level of organization, attention to detail, and professionalism

  • Passion for helping children and adolescents reach their full potential

  • Ability to work independently in-home with minimal supervision

Competencies

  • Accuracy – Consistently records and calculates data correctly

  • Customer Service – Provides quality service, responds to feedback, and meets commitments

  • Organization – Maintains effective time management and use of resources

  • Learning Orientation – Demonstrates willingness to grow professionally and stay up to date on ABA best practices

  • Flexibility – Adapts to changing client needs and schedules

  • Ethical Conduct – Upholds company and BACB ethical standards

  • Problem Solving – Uses critical thinking to address client needs effectively

  • Collaboration – Works well with families, supervisors, and other team members

  • Communication – Clearly communicates with clients, families, and colleagues

Work Environment & Physical Demands

  • This job operates in a client home environment – employees must be comfortable working in various home settings

  • Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs, bend, stoop, reach, and move comfortably in client homes

Employment Terms

  • Position with a flexible schedule based on client needs

  • Employment is at-will, and responsibilities may change as needed

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $21.00 - $27.00 per hour - we believe in pay transparency

Expected hours: 10 per week

Benefits:

  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

  • Evening shift

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: ABA Behavior Technician
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Part-Time Behavior Technician (In-Home ABA) — Lake, MI

Company: Finni Health of Central Michigan (a Finni Health Practice)
Schedule: Tuesday–Thursday, 8:00 AM – 11:00 AM
Job Type: Part-time
Location: In-home services, Lake, MI

Make a Meaningful Impact

Are you passionate about helping children with autism thrive? Join the Finni Health team and become a vital part of a child’s growth journey. We’re hiring Behavior Technicians to provide in-home ABA therapy in the Lake area.

This is more than a job — it’s a chance to change lives while growing your career in a supportive, family-focused environment.

What You’ll Do

As a Behavior Technician, you’ll work 1:1 with children in their home under the guidance of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA). You will:

  • Deliver personalized behavior intervention services

  • Support children in learning daily living, communication, and social skills

  • Collect and document behavior data accurately

  • Collaborate with your clinical team and attend regular team meetings

  • Help implement and refine treatment plans tailored to each child’s needs

What We’re Looking For

  • Education: High school diploma or equivalent required

  • Experience: 1+ year of ABA experience preferred, or experience working with children (especially those with special needs)

  • Passion: A strong desire to work with children and make a positive impact

  • Training: Completion of a 40-hour RBT course (preferred but not required — we can help you get there!)

  • Certification: Must pass the RBT exam within 90 days of hire (we provide support)

  • Other Requirements:

    • Reliable transportation

    • Background check

      • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

Physical Requirements

  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs

  • Ability to sit, stand, kneel, squat, or crawl for extended periods

  • Comfortable working on the floor and actively engaging with children

What We Offer

  • Competitive Pay: $17.00 – $22.00 per hour (based on experience)

  • Paid Training & Professional Development

  • Flexible Scheduling (ideal for students or those seeking consistent part-time work)

  • Paid Time Off & Mental Health Days

  • Mileage Reimbursement

  • Referral Program

  • Career advancement opportunities within Finni Health

Why Finni Health?

At Finni Health, we believe therapy should be fun, engaging, and tailored to each child. Our therapists use creative, play-based approaches to keep sessions exciting and impactful. We work closely with families to celebrate every milestone and create personalized plans for lasting growth.

When you join Finni Health, you're not just starting a job — you're joining a mission-driven team that's passionate about helping children thrive.

Apply today and start making a difference!
We can’t wait to meet you.

#FinniHealth2025

When you join Finni Health, you're not just starting a job — you're joining a mission-driven team that's passionate about helping children thrive.

Apply today and start making a difference!
We can’t wait to meet you.

jobs.title: Clinical Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Finni Health
Finni Health is scaling rapidly to provide top-tier behavioral health services. To support our growth, we are seeking a Clinical Recruiter to drive our talent acquisition efforts and help build a world-class clinical team.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead Talent Acquisition: Manage the full-cycle recruitment process for clinical and support roles, starting with Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) and Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs), and administrative roles supporting the headquarters team.

  • Sourcing & Pipeline Development: Utilize job boards, LinkedIn, social media, and networking strategies to proactively source top-tier candidates.

  • Screening & Selection: Conduct initial screenings, assess qualifications, and coordinate interviews to ensure a strong match with practice owners’ needs.

  • Candidate Experience: Maintain excellent communication with candidates, providing a seamless and engaging recruitment experience.

  • Collaboration with Hiring Managers: Work closely with practice owners and clinical leadership to align hiring strategies with business goals.

  • Offer Management: Assist with extending offers, negotiating terms, and ensuring a smooth transition into onboarding.

  • Tracking & Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in recruitment trackers and dashboards to measure key hiring metrics.

  • Additional Responsibilities: As the company evolves, additional responsibilities may be assigned to align with business needs and hiring goals.


About You

  • Recruiting Experience: 3+ years of experience in healthcare recruiting, preferably within behavioral health, mental health, ABA therapy, or related fields.

  • Sourcing Expertise: Strong ability to source both active and passive candidates using various recruitment strategies.

  • Independent & Self-Motivated: Thrives in an individual contributor role, able to work autonomously and efficiently in a remote setting.

  • Excellent Communicator: Strong written and verbal communication skills to engage candidates and collaborate with hiring teams.

  • Tech-Savvy: Proficiency with applicant tracking systems (we use Ashby), LinkedIn Recruiter, and recruitment tools like Google Sheets and Slack.

  • Adaptable & Agile: Comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment with changing hiring priorities.

Job Type

  • Remote

  • Working hours: Mountain Time / Pacific Time


If you are a motivated and resourceful recruiter who thrives in a dynamic environment, we’d love to hear from you! Apply today to join Finni Health in making a meaningful impact in behavioral health recruitment.

jobs.title: Part-Time BCBA/BCaBA - Garnet Valley, PA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Part-Time Early Childhood BCBA/BCaBA

Join Our Growing Team!

We're seeking a passionate and skilled part-time Early Childhood BCBA/BCaBA to join our dynamic team! We are dedicated to supporting neurodivergent children through Naturalistic Developmental Behavioral Interventions (NDBI) and collaborative, family-centered approaches.


Why Choose Finni Health?

  • Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy paid health insurance, paid time off, 401(k) with matching, and more.

  • Career Growth: Access abundant clinical and professional support, continuing education, and mentorship.

  • Family-Friendly Culture: We understand and support working parents, offering flexible arrangements and compassionate leave.

  • Meaningful Impact: Provide vital ABA services to young children in home, school, and community settings.

  • Collaborative Environment: Work within a supportive team dedicated to the highest standard of care.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Conduct functional behavior assessments (FBA) and develop behavior intervention plans (BIP).

  • Implement behavior plans and provide ongoing monitoring and evaluation.

  • Provide direct behavior intervention services in various settings.

  • Collaborate with families, caregivers, and other professionals.

  • Provide training and support to parents and caregivers.

  • Maintain accurate records and data collection.

  • Participate in team meetings and case consultations.

Qualifications:

  • Master's or bachelor's degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Psychology, Education, or related field.

  • Current BCBA or BCaBA certification from the BACB.

  • Experience in early childhood development and education.

  • Knowledge of ABA principles and NDBI.

  • Strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.

  • Ability to provide in home and community based services.


Compensation Package:

  • Salary ($45-$60/hour equivalent)


Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

  • Evening shift

  • Monday to Friday


License/Certification:

  • BCBA or BCaBA certification (Required).


Work Location:

  • In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Remote Board Certified Behavior Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Remote Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)

Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of children with autism and looking for a rewarding career in ABA therapy?

What We Offer:

  • Competitive pay

  • Health Insurance

  • Flexible scheduling tailored to you, daytime hours available

  • Opportunities for growth within our expanding company


About the Role:

As a BCBA, you’ll work closely with children and their families, providing compassionate and effective behavior therapy. You’ll have the support of a skilled clinical team and structured supervision to help you succeed and grow in your role.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Conduct assessments of patients with developmental disabilities and autism

  • Develop and implement individualized behavior intervention plans

  • Provide behavioral therapy and support to patients

  • Monitor and evaluate patient progress, adjusting treatment plans as necessary

  • Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure comprehensive care for patients

  • Maintain accurate and confidential medical documentation in compliance with HIPAA regulations

  • Stay up-to-date with current research and best practices in behavioral health


Schedule:

  • Flexible with daytime hours available, Full-time

Qualifications:

  • Passionate, dependable, and committed to positive client outcomes

  • Experience working with children and individuals with developmental disabilities or autism

  • Strong knowledge of behavioral assessment techniques and interventions

  • Ability to conduct diagnostic evaluations and develop individualized treatment plans

  • Proficient in behavioral therapy techniques and strategies

  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

  • Strong interpersonal skills for working with patients, families, and interdisciplinary teams

  • Attention to detail and ability to maintain accurate medical documentation

Join a team that values your dedication and offers opportunities for career development. Apply today to open doors to a brighter future at Finni Health!


Benefits:

  • Competitive pay with opportunities for bonuses.

  • Flexible scheduling.

  • Supportive work environment with opportunities for career growth.


How to Apply:
If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of children and are committed to providing excellent ABA services, we encourage you to apply! Thank you!

jobs.title: ABA Behavior Technician - Suffolk County, NY
jobs.descriptionHtml:
ABA Behavior Technician - Windwatch Behavioral Therapy

📍Suffolk County, New York | 🗓️ Part-time, 3:00 pm to 8:00 pm| 💵 $25.00 - $30.00/hour


At Windwatch Behavioral Therapy, empowered by Finni Health, we help children grow their skills and confidence through high-quality, individualized ABA therapy. If you’re caring, dependable, and excited about working with kids, we’d love to meet you!

Learn more about Windwatch Behavioral Therapy on our website!

What You’ll Do

  • Provide 1:1 ABA therapy to children in an in-home setting

  • Teach communication, social, play, and daily living skills

  • Collect data and follow treatment plans under BCBA supervision

  • Support families and collaborate with team members

  • Uphold all policies, ethics, and confidentiality standards

  • Participate in ongoing training, supervision, and team meetings

  • Bring a spirit of curiosity and willingness to learn

  • Other duties as assigned to support our mission

What We Offer

  • Competitive Compensation

  • 100% reimbursement for your Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) exam, CPR certification, and license renewal

  • Health, Dental and Vision Insurance (for eligible staff)

  • Short Term Disability insurance (for eligible staff)

  • 401(k) program (for eligible staff)

  • A supportive team that encourages growth

What You’ll Need

  • High school diploma or equivalent (degree is a plus)

  • Experience working with children or individuals with behavioral disorders

  • CPR certification (or willingness to obtain within first 30-days)

  • Reliable transportation and willingness to travel locally to client homes

Apply today to start your journey at Windwatch Behavioral Therapy!

Finni Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
Location: Davis County, UT
Job Type: Part-Time or Full-Time
Compensation: $18–$22 per hour, based on experience

About the Role

We are seeking passionate and dedicated Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) to join a supportive and growing ABA practice. This is a great opportunity for professionals who are excited to provide meaningful, individualized care and thrive in a collaborative clinical environment.

We have current openings in Davis County and Salt Lake City, UT. The position offers a flexible schedule, with part-time and full-time options available.

RBTs play a critical role in delivering high-quality behavior therapy to children and families. You’ll work closely with a supervising BCBA to implement treatment plans and help clients build essential skills.

Responsibilities

  • Deliver 1:1 ABA therapy to children in-home or community settings

  • Implement behavior intervention plans developed by a BCBA

  • Collect and document accurate data on client progress

  • Participate in team meetings and ongoing training

  • Communicate professionally with families and team members

Qualifications

  • Active RBT certification through the BACB

  • Experience working with children, preferably in ABA or related fields

  • Strong communication, reliability, and professionalism

  • A compassionate and patient approach to care

  • Ability to pass background checks and meet other compliance requirements

What We Offer

  • A supportive and team-oriented work culture

  • Ongoing clinical support and supervision

  • Opportunities for professional development and growth

  • Flexible scheduling options to fit school or other commitments

  • Competitive pay: $18–$22 per hour

  • Work opportunities in both Salt Lake City and Davis County

How to Apply
Please submit your resume and contact information to be considered. We look forward to learning more about you and how you can contribute to our mission of providing high-quality ABA services.

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Part-Time Early Childhood BCBA/BCaBA


Hybrid Options + Flexible Schedule | $50–$65/hr BCBA | $40–$50/hr BCaBA

Finally — a Role That Fits Your Life and Your Passion!

At Odyssey ABA, LLC (empowered by Finni Health), we believe you can love what you do and still have time for the people and things that matter most. We’re looking for a dedicated BCBA or BCaBA who wants to make a meaningful difference in the lives of neurodivergent children while enjoying a healthy work-life balance and a truly supportive team.

Why BCBAs/BCaBAs Love Working Here

  • Work-Life Balance You Can Count On – Choose your schedule, work hybrid when needed, and keep your caseload manageable so you can give your best without burning out.

  • You’re Never On Your Own – Join a collaborative team that celebrates wins, helps troubleshoot challenges, and values your expertise.

  • Competitive Pay – $50–$65/hr for BCBAs, $40–$50/hr for BCaBAs.

Your Impact

  • Conduct functional behavior assessments (FBAs) and develop individualized BIPs.

  • Deliver direct ABA services in home, with potential for school and community settings.

  • Partner with parents, caregivers, and professionals to create consistent support.

  • Empower families through training and coaching.

  • Monitor progress and make data-informed adjustments.

  • Participate in collaborative case consultations and team meetings.

What We’re Looking For

  • Master’s in ABA, Psychology, Education, or related field.

  • Current BCBA or BCaBA certification (BACB) & Virginia state license.

  • Early childhood experience preferred.

  • Ability to provide in-home services and work some evenings.

  • Strong communication, organization, and problem-solving skills.

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Benefits & Perks

(Full-time staff enjoy the complete package — part-time employees enjoy proportional benefits)

  • Paid health, dental, and vision insurance

  • Paid time off

  • 401(k)

  • Continuing education credits & professional development assistance

  • Mileage reimbursement

  • Flexible scheduling

  • Short-term Disability

Schedule Options

  • After school hours

  • Evening shifts

  • Monday–Friday with optional weekend opportunities

If you’re ready for a BCBA/BCaBA role that values your time, your expertise, and your future, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today and join a team where your impact is celebrated every day!

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: BCBA - ABA Therapy for Children - South Carolina
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Inspire ABA, empowered by Finni Health, is looking for a dedicated BCBA to join our team!

We’re a BCBA-owned, BCBA-led practice committed to delivering compassionate, evidence-based care while creating a supportive environment where clinicians can thrive and grow. Learn more about Inspire ABA (empowered by Finni Health) here!

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Expert Mentorship – Receive mentorship and support from BCBAs and BCBA-Ds with 10+ years in ABA and related disciplines.

  • Challenging & Rewarding Work – Make an impact across the lifespan, including with clients who present with complex behaviors (SIB, aggression, elopement, etc.).

  • Growth-Oriented Culture – Ongoing training, collaboration, and hands-on clinical support at every step.

  • Work-Life Balance – Increasing PTO with years of service (up to 3 weeks!) and a team that truly values its clinicians.

Position Details

Hours: Full-time or part-time

  • Compensation: $60–65/hour

  • Setting: In-home, with hybrid options available

At Inspire ABA, you’ll be part of a team that puts people first - our clients and our clinicians.

Responsibilities

  • Conducting functional behavior assessments (FBA) and developing behavior intervention plans (BIP) for individuals with autism, developmental disabilities, and other behavioral disorders

  • Implementing behavior plans and providing ongoing monitoring, evaluation, and modification as needed

  • Providing direct behavior intervention services to clients in various settings, including home, school, and community

  • Collaborating with families, caregivers, teachers, and other professionals to ensure the effective implementation of behavior plans and the generalization of skills

  • Providing training and support to parents, caregivers, and staff on behavior management techniques, data collection, and other relevant topics

  • Maintaining accurate and up-to-date records, including progress notes, behavior plans, and data collection sheets

  • Participating in team meetings, case conferences, and other professional development opportunities

Qualifications

  • Master's degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Psychology, Education, or a related field

  • Current BCBA certification from the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB)

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in behavior analysis and intervention

  • Knowledge of principles and practices of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) and evidence-based interventions for individuals with autism and other developmental disabilities

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to conduct functional assessments, develop behavior plans, and analyze data

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients, families, and professionals from diverse backgrounds

  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a strong commitment to professional ethics and standards

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Benefits (Benefits Eligible for full-time staff 30+ hours per week)

  • Dental insurance

  • Flexible schedule

  • Health insurance

  • 401K

  • Paid time off

  • Sick Time

  • Vision insurance

  • License Renewal Reimbursement

License/Certification

  • BCBA (Required)

Work Location: In-home, hybrid

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
Open Doors ABA
Part-time, M-W 2:30pm-6:30pm in Portland, TN

*Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of children with autism and looking for a rewarding career in ABA therapy? Open Doors ABA is hiring dedicated RBTs to join our supportive and dynamic team!

What We Offer:

  • Competitive pay starting at $23 - $25 per hour

  • Supervision towards BCBA/BCaBA certifications

  • Health Insurance

  • Flexible scheduling tailored to you

  • Opportunities for growth within our expanding company

About the Role:
As an RBT with Open Doors ABA, you’ll work closely with children and their families, providing compassionate and effective behavior therapy. You’ll have the support of a skilled clinical team and structured supervision to help you succeed and grow in your role.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Implement individualized ABA treatment plans under BCBA supervision

  • Track client progress and record accurate session notes

  • Engage with children in fun, educational activities to foster growth and learning

Qualifications:

  • RBT Certification

  • Passionate, dependable, and committed to positive client outcomes

Join a team that values your dedication and offers opportunities for career development. Apply today to open doors to a brighter future at Open Doors ABA!

Benefits:

  • Competitive pay with opportunities for bonuses.

  • Ongoing training and supervision by experienced BCBAs.

  • Flexible scheduling.

  • Supportive work environment with opportunities for career growth.

How to Apply:
If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of children and are committed to providing excellent ABA services, we encourage you to apply! Thank you!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $23.00 - $25.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift

  • Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

  • Are you available to work part-time, M-W 2:30pm-6:30pm?

License/Certification:

  • RBT Certification (Required)

Work Location: In person

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

    #FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: General Interest: Early-Career BCBA or BCaBA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
General Interest: Early-Career BCBA or BCaBA

Location: Varies by Practice (In-Home, Clinic, Hybrid, School)
Job Type: Part-time or Full-time
Pay Range: dependent on credentials, experience, and region

Are you a newly certified BCBA or a BCaBA working toward full certification? We’d love to meet you. At Finni Health, we believe better care starts by empowering the people who provide it. Whether you’re looking for supervision, mentorship, or your first ABA leadership opportunity—we’re here to support your journey.

This is a general interest job post for early-career BCBAs and BCaBAs who are curious about joining our growing team. If we don’t have a current opening in your area, we’ll keep your information on file and reach out when we do!

What We Offer:

  • ✅ Structured BCaBA Supervision & Mentorship
    Hands-on support from seasoned BCBAs to help you grow clinically and professionally.

  • ✅ Flexible Scheduling
    Choose part-time or full-time roles that align with your lifestyle and goals.

  • ✅ Diverse Client Opportunities
    School, home, and community-based clients across a variety of ages and diagnoses.

  • ✅ Innovative Team Culture
    A startup-driven team where your voice matters and collaboration fuels progress.

  • ✅ Career Pathways
    We invest in our team with clear growth tracks and ongoing training.

Qualifications:

  • 📘 Current BCBA or BCaBA Certification (in good standing with BACB) with 0-5 years of experience

  • 💬 Passion for client care and team collaboration

  • 🚗 Reliable transportation for in-person sessions

  • 💻 Strong documentation and communication skills

  • 🧠 Eager to learn, grow, and make a difference

  • 📣 To protect our clients and their families, all clinical positions require a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

How to Apply:

Click Apply Now to submit your resume and become part of our Talent Community!

We can’t wait to learn more about you!

📣 Finni Health is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Software Developer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Senior Full-Stack Software Developer

🔥 Since our Series A last year, we've become one of the fastest-growing startups to hit Series-B metrics, and now we're hiring for a Senior Full-Stack Software Developer to join our team to work on building the foundations of our products and vision.

We're looking for talented and motivated developers with 4+ years of experience. Our developers own products from end-to-end. If you're interested in building elegant software with far-reaching effects in our modern healthcare landscape, join us!

What You'll Do

  • Design initial feature specifications.

  • Build robust backend APIs.

  • Write intuitive frontend code.

  • Oversee ongoing improvements for launched products.

  • Drive projects from concept to completion in an environment of autonomy and creativity.

  • Shape not just our product, but our culture: who you work with, and how we all work together.

  • Make foundational technical decisions critical to the company's success.

  • Work incredibly closely with co-founders, investors, and customers to deeply understand problems and build the best product.

Our current stack includes: React, React Native, Typescript, and Firebase.

How We Work

  • We're a hybrid team with members across Canada and the US.

  • Our main tools of collaboration are Slack, Notion, Figma, Google Meets, and email.

  • We foster an environment where you can learn the inner workings of a growing startup.

  • You'll contribute during investor meetings and demonstrate your features to potential customers.

  • We genuinely expect you to take advantage of this learning opportunity of a lifetime, even to potentially start your own venture in the future.

About You

We're looking for a product-minded developer who:

  • Actively engages with the 'why' behind what they're building.

  • Has a thirst for using technologies to leapfrog human problems.

  • Has a strong track record of bringing products to life.

  • Has experience in a backend framework (like Node).

  • Is proficient with the staples of full-stack web development: HTML, JavaScript, and CSS.

  • Understands the balance between moving fast and building for the long haul in an early-stage startup.

  • Can minimize scope, prioritize ruthlessly, and implement rigorously.

  • Takes ownership and sees things through to completion.

  • Can take a stand yet commit even when they disagree.

  • Doesn't need heavy direction and enjoys the 'grey' areas.

  • Likes open-ended problems and thrives in the face of uncertainty – the elements of a startup environment.

Our Interview Process

Our interview process is designed to be thorough and respectful of your time:

  • Take-Home Assignment: A practical exercise to assess your coding skills.

  • Technical Interview: A deeper dive into your technical expertise and problem-solving.

  • Team Interview: An opportunity to meet potential teammates and discuss collaboration.


Ready to make a significant impact at a fast-growing health-tech startup? Apply now to join our team!

 - Doesn't need heavy direction and enjoys the 'grey' areas.

 - Likes open-ended problems and thrives in the face of uncertainty – the elements of a startup environment.


OUR INTERVIEW PROCESS

Our interview process is designed to be thorough and respectful of your time:

 - Take-Home Assignment: A practical exercise to assess your coding skills.

 - Technical Interview: A deeper dive into your technical expertise and problem-solving.

 - Team Interview: An opportunity to meet potential teammates and discuss collaboration.


Ready to make a significant impact at a fast-growing health-tech startup? Apply now to join our team!

jobs.title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA or BCaBA) PT or FT
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We're Hiring: BCBA / BCaBA – Make a Lasting Impact in Bennington, VT!
Chockstone Behavior Consulting in partnership with Finni Health

Are you a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) or Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst (BCaBA) with a passion for helping children thrive? Join a collaborative, mission-driven team at Chockstone Behavior Consulting, where your skills and heart will change lives in the Bennington, VT community.


🌟 What You’ll Do

As a BCBA or BCaBA on our team, you’ll play a vital role in delivering compassionate, evidence-based behavioral health services. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Conducting assessments and diagnostic evaluations for children with autism and developmental disabilities

  • Developing and implementing individualized behavior intervention and treatment plans

  • Providing one-on-one therapy and family support

  • Supervising and mentoring BTs/RBTs to ensure consistent, high-quality care

  • Collaborating with interdisciplinary teams to create well-rounded care solutions

  • Maintaining accurate and confidential documentation (HIPAA-compliant)

  • Staying informed on current research and best practices in behavioral health


🧠 What You Bring

We’re looking for team members who are not only qualified but genuinely care.

  • BCBA or BCaBA Certification

  • Master’s Degree in Applied Behavior Analysis or a related field

  • Experience working with children and individuals with autism or developmental disabilities

  • Strong clinical and interpersonal communication skills

  • Empathy, patience, and a commitment to client-centered care

  • Reliable transportation

  • Active CPR Certification (we'll help you get certified if needed)

  • Ability to pass a background check (required by funding sources)

  • Willingness and physical ability to work directly with children (lift up to 50 lbs, kneel, sit on the floor, etc.)

💼 Why Join Us?

We know that when our team members thrive, our clients do too. Here’s how we support your growth and well-being:

  • 💰 Competitive Pay: $60.00–$70.00/hr, depending on experience

  • 🏥 Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance (Full-Time)

  • 🕒 Flexible Scheduling: Day and evening shifts available

  • 🚗 Mileage Reimbursement

  • 📈 Career Growth: Performance-based raises, mentorship, and leadership opportunities

  • 📚 Ongoing Training: Access to CEUs and fieldwork supervision

  • 🌴 Paid Time Off (Full-Time)

  • 🤝 Supportive Leadership: We prioritize clinician well-being and value-driven, ethical care


🧩 Who We Are

At Chockstone Behavior Consulting, we’re more than just a behavioral health provider—we’re a team united by purpose. Through Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA), trauma-informed care, and Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, we help clients achieve meaningful goals and greater independence.

We proudly serve communities where access to services may be limited and focus on creating values-based, assent-driven, and person-centered care. When you join Chockstone, you’re helping to shape the future of ethical, effective ABA.

📍 Location

This is an in-person position serving the Bennington, VT area. Candidates must be willing to relocate prior to starting.

📅 Job Type

  • Full-time or Part-time

  • 20–40 hours per week

💬 Apply Now!

Ready to bring your clinical skills, creativity, and compassion to a team that values your growth? We’d love to meet you!

➡️ Submit your application and let’s talk about how you can be part of something meaningful.

#FinniHealth2025

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Business Operations and Finance Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Finni Health, a rapidly growing company (400% growth, approaching profitability, backed by General Catalyst), is seeking a Business Operations and Finance Associate to drive operational excellence and support our scaling efforts. We're revolutionizing ABA clinics by helping providers grow their businesses while delivering top-tier patient care.

Finni Health equips care providers with tools that enable the absolute best ABA services. Founded with a deep commitment to empowering individual therapists, Finni Health was created to address the long-standing challenges ABA professionals face in traditional clinic settings. We believe that by combining cutting-edge software with world-class providers, we can offer a comprehensive solution that enables BCBAs to focus on what truly matters—delivering exceptional care to families. Our vision is to revolutionize ABA services by equipping therapists with the support and resources they need to thrive.

Duties:

  • Preparing, reviewing, and distributing profit and loss (P&L) statements for all practices, along with supporting documentation for transparency and decision-making

  • Partnering with Practice Owners to understand their growth objectives and recommending strategic support initiatives, such as promotional stipends or custom arrangements

  • Developing playbooks and scoring systems to assess practice performance and determine appropriate support measures

  • Conducting in-depth analyses of practice-level changes (e.g., staffing adjustments, expanded hours, compensation changes, operational inefficiencies), working closely with Provider Success Managers

  • Evaluating new and emerging practice models, such as partnerships with school systems or community-based setups

  • Identifying and implementing cost-reduction opportunities across the organization

  • Building and maintaining gross margin tracking for each practice by period; analyzing trends and performance drivers to support strategic decisions

  • Visiting practices to observe operations firsthand, identify areas for improvement, and share best practices across the network

  • Designing and maintaining dashboards that track key company metrics, including growth, financial performance, customer demographics, and provider productivity

  • Drafting provider contracts and partnership arrangements, ensuring clarity and compliance

  • Creating and maintaining thorough documentation of SOPs and training materials to support onboarding and cross-functional training

  • Collaborating with the Engineering team to identify and implement automation and process improvement opportunities for internal workflows and external provider/practice owner tools

  • Providing cross-functional support to other teams and departments as needed (eg. HR, sales, revenue cycle-management, etc), and contributing to company-wide initiatives

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, commerce, or finance is required.

  • 2 years in management consulting is required

  • Proficiency in Excel, Powerpoint, SQL, and GSuite

  • Demonstrated ability to analyze financial trends, gross margin, and performance drivers to guide strategic decisions

  • Experience working directly with business owners or operators to understand growth goals and tailor support solutions

  • Skilled in building dashboards to track performance across financial, operational, and productivity metrics

  • Strong track record of collaborating with teams such as HR, revenue cycle management, provider success, product/engineering, or sales to drive organization-wide initiatives

  • Proven ability to evaluate and recommend incentive structures, stipends, or partnership arrangements

  • Background in identifying and addressing inefficiencies at the team, clinic, or system level

  • Experience in healthcare, behavioral health, or multi-site service operations

  • Excellent organizational and time management skills, with keen attention to detail

  • Ability to communicate and work with internal teams and external business customers

  • Experience working with business customers, providing support, managing relationships, and gathering feedback for product improvements

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) – Full-time | Santa Fe, NM
Location: Santa Fe, NM
Company: Sun and Sage ABA
Type: Full-time
Compensation: $20.00 – $27.00 per hour (based on experience and certification status)
Schedule: Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM

Make a Meaningful Impact with Sun and Sage ABA!

We’re looking for a compassionate, dependable, and enthusiastic Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) to work afternoons in Santa Fe, NM! You'll provide 1:1 support to children with autism using Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA), guided by a supervising BCBA.

Whether you're an experienced RBT or have a background in ABA or childcare and are ready to get certified—we'll support you every step of the way with paid training, mentorship, and a caring team environment.

🍃 Learn more about us at www.sunandsageaba.com

What You’ll Do:

✨ Work directly with clients to implement personalized ABA treatment plans
✨ Use positive, evidence-based strategies to support communication and daily living skills
✨ Collect data to track progress and celebrate success
✨ Provide engaging and safe sessions in a supportive environment
✨ Collaborate with BCBAs, caregivers, and teammates
✨ Maintain documentation in compliance with HIPAA

What We’re Looking For:

✅ Certified RBTs highly encouraged to apply
✅ ABA or childcare experience also welcomed (training pay available while becoming certified)
✅ Strong communication and organization skills
✅ Patience, empathy, and commitment to helping others
✅ Comfortable working weekdays (9AM–5 PM)

Why Join Us?

🍃 $20–$27/hour based on experience and certification
🍃 PTO and Sick Leave for all employees
🍃 Pay increase after 90 days based on performance
🍃 Bonuses following positive performance reviews
🍃 Paid training + paid indirect time
🍃 Ongoing BCBA mentorship and supervision
🍃 Supportive, inclusive team culture
🍃 Growth opportunities into leadership or BCBA-track roles

Job Details:

Job Type: Full-time
Schedule: Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Location: In-person sessions in Santa Fe, NM

Ready to make your days more meaningful?
Apply today and become part of a team that leads with compassion, connection, and purpose.

🌞 Visit us at www.sunandsageaba.com to learn more about who we are.

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.
