jobs.title: Part-Time Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location: Norfolk and Virginia Beach, VA
Setting: In-home
Schedule: Monday to Friday, 4:00 - 6:00 pm
Pay: $15.00-25.00/hour depending on experience

As a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing ABA care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping individuals learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in an individual's home setting and community

  • Collect and record data on patient behaviors

  • Be available weekly for supervision by the Behavior Analyst

  • Attend team meetings

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Sick Days

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within the field

  • Obtain Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certification within 90 days of hire

  • Experience or willingness to work with young adults with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Must have an active CPR Certification

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are At Finni Health

Finni Health empowers BCBAs to launch local in-home ABA clinics. We are bringing together world-class therapists, marketers and technology enthusiasts to build the future of autism care. Help join us change the modality of care together!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $15.00-25.00 per hour

Benefits (Full-Time Staff Only)

  • Dental insurance

  • Health insurance

  • Mileage reimbursement

  • Paid time off

  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Day shift, Evening Shift

  • Monday to Friday

License/Certification:

  • CPR Certification (Required)

Work Location: On-site

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
Location: Salt Lake City & Davis County, UT
Job Type: Part-Time (10–15 hours/week, flexible schedule)
Compensation: $18–$22 per hour, based on experience

About the Role

We are seeking passionate and dedicated Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) to join a supportive and growing ABA practice. This is a great opportunity for professionals who are excited to provide meaningful, individualized care and thrive in a collaborative clinical environment.

We have current openings in Davis County and Salt Lake City, UT. The position offers 10–15 hours per week with a flexible schedule, making it an excellent opportunity for students studying ABA or related fields.

RBTs play a critical role in delivering high-quality behavior therapy to children and families. You’ll work closely with a supervising BCBA to implement treatment plans and help clients build essential skills.

Responsibilities

  • Deliver 1:1 ABA therapy to children in-home, clinic, or community settings

  • Implement behavior intervention plans developed by a BCBA

  • Collect and document accurate data on client progress

  • Participate in team meetings and ongoing training

  • Communicate professionally with families and team members

Qualifications

  • Active RBT certification through the BACB

  • Experience working with children, preferably in ABA or related fields

  • Strong communication, reliability, and professionalism

  • A compassionate and patient approach to care

  • Ability to pass background checks and meet other compliance requirements

What We Offer

  • A supportive and team-oriented work culture

  • Ongoing clinical support and supervision

  • Opportunities for professional development and growth

  • Flexible scheduling options to fit school or other commitments

  • Competitive pay: $18–$22 per hour

  • Work opportunities in both Salt Lake City and Davis County

How to Apply
Please submit your resume and contact information to be considered. We look forward to learning more about you and how you can contribute to our mission of providing high-quality ABA services.

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

 - Paid time off

 - Vision insurance

Schedule:

 - Monday to Friday

 - CPR Certification (Required)

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Overview
We are seeking a dedicated Registered Behavior Technician to join our team. As an RBT, you will play a crucial role in implementing behavior plans and providing direct support to individuals with developmental disabilities. This position offers an opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of those we serve.

Responsibilities
- Implement behavior intervention plans under the supervision of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
- Provide one-on-one behavior therapy to individuals with developmental disabilities
- Assist clients with activities of daily living (ADLs) as needed
- Maintain accurate and confidential client medical records
- Collect and record data on client progress during therapy sessions
- Collaborate with the treatment team to ensure effective implementation of behavior management strategies
- Adhere to HIPAA regulations and maintain client confidentiality at all times

Qualifications

- Active RBT Credential in good standing

- Experience working with children or individuals with developmental disabilities
- Knowledge of behavioral therapy principles and techniques
- Strong interpersonal skills for working with individuals and their families
- Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with team members
- Proficiency in behavior management strategies
- Willingness to learn and follow behavior intervention plans accurately

Joining our team as an RBT offers the opportunity to grow in the field of behavioral health while positively impacting the lives of others.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $21.00 - $26.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • License reimbursement

  • Opportunities for advancement

  • Paid time off

  • Paid training

  • Professional development assistance

  • Referral program

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

  • Weekends as needed

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Required)

Job Types: Part-time

Pay: $21.00 - $26.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • After school

  • Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

  • Are you available to work part-time, M-F, around 15 hours per week?

License/Certification:

  • RBT Certification (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

Work Location: In-Home, School

#FinniHealth2025

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Open Doors ABA
Part-time M-F 4pm-6pm

*Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of children with autism and looking for a rewarding career in ABA therapy? Open Doors ABA is hiring dedicated RBTs to join our supportive and dynamic team!

  • Competitive pay starting at $23.50-$27 per hour

  • Supervision towards BCBA/BCaBA certifications

  • Health Insurance

  • Flexible scheduling tailored to you

  • Opportunities for growth within our expanding company

About the Role:
As an RBT with Open Doors ABA, you’ll work closely with children and their families, providing compassionate and effective behavior therapy. You’ll have the support of a skilled clinical team and structured supervision to help you succeed and grow in your role.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Implement individualized ABA treatment plans under BCBA supervision

  • Track client progress and record accurate session notes

  • Engage with children in fun, educational activities to foster growth and learning

Schedule:

  • As applicable for clients

  • Passionate, dependable, and committed to positive client outcomes

Join a team that values your dedication and offers opportunities for career development. Apply today to open doors to a brighter future at Open Doors ABA!

Benefits:

  • Competitive pay with opportunities for bonuses.

  • Ongoing training and supervision by experienced BCBAs.

  • Flexible scheduling.

  • Supportive work environment with opportunities for career growth.

If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of children and are committed to providing excellent ABA services, we encourage you to apply! Thank you!

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/Registered Behavior Technician
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Finni is looking for a BT/RBT!

As a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing ABA care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting and community

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Be available weekly for supervision by the Behavior Analyst

  • Attend team meetings

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Sick Days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within the field

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Must have an active CPR Certification

  • Must be willing to become RBT certified within specific time frame

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are At Finni Health

Finni Health empowers BCBAs to launch local in-home ABA clinics. We are bringing together world-class therapists, marketers and technology enthusiasts to build the future of autism care. Help join us change the modality of care together!

Job Type: part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance

  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

  • Are you located within a 45-minute drive of Dyersburg, TN?

  • RBT Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician (Part-Time) – Norwalk, OH
Hours:

  • Monday - Wednesday: 5PM-7PM

SparkJoy ABA, in partnership with Finni Health, is seeking a compassionate and motivated Behavior Technician to provide in-home ABA therapy to children with autism in Norwalk, OH.

Why Join Us?
We’re a mission-driven, clinician-led company focused on ethical care and meaningful outcomes—not investor pressure. Enjoy free advanced training, ongoing BCBA support, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact.

Your Role:

  • Work 1:1 with children in-home using individualized ABA treatment plans

  • Teach communication, daily living, and social skills

  • Collect data and collaborate with supervising BCBAs

  • Support families through parent training and consistent communication

  • Work Environment - This job operates in a client's home environment. Employees must feel comfortable going into client homes and neighborhoods within the assigned territory.

What You Bring:

  • 1+ year experience with children with autism or developmental disabilities

  • Strong communication, time management, and organizational skills

  • A passion for helping children grow and succeed

  • Reliable transportation to client homes in Ashland

Job Details:

  • Part-time: 6 hours/week

  • Pay: $17–$22/hr

  • Benefits: PTO, professional development

Join a company that values people over profit. SparkJoy ABA is changing lives—one session at a time.

Apply today and spark joy in a child’s life.

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Clarksville Autism Center is seeking compassionate and dedicated Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) to join our team!

The RBT will work directly with children diagnosed with autism and other developmental disorders, implementing behavior intervention plans under the supervision of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA). This role is crucial in helping children develop essential skills and improve their quality of life through applied behavior analysis (ABA) techniques.

Responsibilities

  • Implement individualized behavior intervention plans as directed by the supervising BCBA.

  • Collect and record data on the child's progress and behavior during sessions.

  • Assist in the development of care plans tailored to each child's needs.

  • Maintain accurate medical documentation in compliance with HIPAA regulations.

  • Utilize behavior management techniques to promote positive behaviors and reduce challenging behaviors.

  • Collaborate with families and caregivers to ensure consistency in behavioral strategies across different environments.

  • Participate in ongoing training and professional development opportunities related to special education and applied behavior analysis.

Experience

  • Previous experience working with children, particularly those with special needs, is preferred.

  • RBT certification is required.

  • Previous experience with high-aggression youth is highly desired. Willingness to work with this population is a must.

  • Familiarity with data collection methods and ABA terminology is essential.

  • Understanding of HIPAA regulations and confidentiality practices is required.

  • Experience in behavior management strategies and applied behavior analysis techniques is a plus.

  • A background in special education or related fields will be beneficial for this role.

Join us in making a meaningful impact on the lives of children and their families through dedicated support and professional care!

Job Type: Full-time and Part-time available

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 – 40 per week

Benefits:

  • Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance

  • 401(k) Retirement Plan

  • Paid Time Off

    • Accrual-based vacation

    • Sick pay

    • Paid holidays

  • Short-Term Disability Insurance

    • Provides 60% salary replacement for qualifying illnesses, injuries, or maternity leave

  • Mileage Reimbursement

  • Reinforcement Budget (for professional development or supplies)

  • Company-Provided iPad

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

License/Certification:

  • RBT Certification (Required)

  • CPR Certification (Required)

Ability to Commute:

  • Clarksville, TN 37043 (Required)

Work Location: In person

#FinniHealth2025

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician (Part-Time or Full-time) – Ontario, OH
Hours:

  • Monday - Friday: 3:30PM-6:30PM (part-time) or 12PM-7:30PM (Full-time)

SparkJoy ABA, in partnership with Finni Health, is seeking a compassionate and motivated Behavior Technician to provide in-home ABA therapy to children with autism in Ashland, OH.

Why Join Us?
We’re a mission-driven, clinician-led company focused on ethical care and meaningful outcomes—not investor pressure. Enjoy free advanced training, ongoing BCBA support, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact.

Your Role:

  • Work 1:1 with children in-home using individualized ABA treatment plans

  • Teach communication, daily living, and social skills

  • Collect data and collaborate with supervising BCBAs

  • Support families through parent training and consistent communication

  • Work Environment - This job operates in a client's home environment. Employees must feel comfortable going into client homes and neighborhoods within the assigned territory.

What You Bring:

  • 1+ year experience with children with autism or developmental disabilities

  • Strong communication, time management, and organizational skills

  • A passion for helping children grow and succeed

  • Reliable transportation to client homes in Ashland

Job Details:

  • Part-time: 15 hours/week part-time, or 37.5 hours/week full-time option

  • Pay: $17–$22/hr

  • Benefits: PTO, professional development

Join a company that values people over profit. SparkJoy ABA is changing lives—one session at a time.

Apply today and spark joy in a child’s life.

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Autism Behavior Therapist/Registered Behavior Technician (RBT): Part-Time - Long Island, NY
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Autism Behavior Therapist / Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) – Part-Time – Long Island, NY


About the Role:
Cove ABA (empowered by Finni Health) is seeking dedicated ABA Therapists, Behavior Technicians (BT), or Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) to deliver in-home therapy to children with autism, specializing in early intervention for ages 2-6. Whether you’re an experienced RBT/BT or new to the ABA field, we provide a supportive and rewarding environment to grow your career.


Why Join Cove ABA? 🎉

  • 💰 Competitive pay

  • 🏥 Medical, dental, and vision insurance

  • 💼 401(k) plan

  • 🚀 Career growth and professional development opportunities


Responsibilities:

  • Provide 1:1 ABA therapy in clients’ homes

  • Implement behavior intervention plans under BCBA supervision

  • Collect and record therapy data to measure progress towards treatment goals


Required Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or equivalent

  • Experience working with children ages 2-6 is required

  • Experience or willingness to work with clients exhibiting high-aggression behaviors (such as teens with severe behaviors)

  • Reliable transportation and ability to commute to clients’ homes

  • Active RBT and CPR certification preferred (training available if you’re not certified yet)

  • Completion of a 40-hour RBT training course within the designated timeframe

  • Ability to pass a background check

  • Must be eligible to work in the United States


Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to kneel, squat, sit, and stand for extended periods

  • Work on the floor or standing, as sessions require


About Finni Health:
At Finni Health, we are committed to providing high-quality Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) to children with autism and developmental disabilities. Our focus on early intervention helps children reach their full potential. Join our team and make a real impact in the lives of the families we serve.


Job Type: Part-time


Compensation: $25.00–$35.00 per hour

jobs.title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) - Windwatch Behavioral Therapy
Kings Park / Smithtown – Suffolk County, NY | Part-time, Hybrid (Before School & After School Hours) | $75.00 - $90.00/hour

At Windwatch Behavioral Therapy, empowered by Finni Health, we believe every child deserves the opportunity to thrive. We're looking for a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) who is passionate about delivering high-quality, personalized ABA services to children and families. If you're collaborative, confident, and driven to make a difference, we’d love to meet you.

Learn more about us at Windwatch Behavioral Therapy

What You’ll Do

  • Conduct assessments and develop individualized treatment plans

  • Provide supervision and training to Behavior Technicians

  • Monitor client progress and adjust treatment goals as needed

  • Collaborate with families, schools, and team members to support each child’s development

  • Deliver ABA services in a hybrid model (a combination of in-home and virtual services)

  • Work before school and after school hours, based on client needs

  • Maintain accurate data and clinical documentation

  • Ensure compliance with ethical and professional standards

  • Participate in team meetings and ongoing professional development

What We Offer

  • Competitive hourly rate of $75–$90

  • Flexible hybrid schedule and part-time hours

  • Supportive, mission-driven team culture

  • 401(k) program (for eligible staff)

  • Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance (for eligible staff)

  • Short Term Disability Insurance (for eligible staff)

  • Opportunities for continued learning and professional growth

What You’ll Need

  • Current BCBA certification in good standing

  • Master’s degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Psychology, Education, or related field

  • Experience in supervising ABA programs and working directly with children with autism or developmental delays

  • Strong organizational and communication skills

  • Reliable transportation and ability to travel locally within Kings Park / Smithtown

  • Passion for helping children and families succeed

Apply today to join Windwatch Behavioral Therapy and make a lasting impact in the lives of the families we serve.

Finni Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst - Remote
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Remote BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) – Tennessee LBA
Open Doors ABA | Powered by Finni Health
Make an Impact. Work Flexibly. Grow with Us.

🔍 About the Role:
Open Doors ABA is seeking a passionate and dedicated Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) with an active Tennessee LBA license to join our growing team. Start part-time (5–25 hrs/week) with the opportunity to increase to full-time (25+ hrs/week) based on your goals and performance.

This is a remote, flexible position where you’ll provide high-quality, individualized ABA services to children with autism and developmental disabilities—backed by a collaborative and supportive clinical team.

✨ What We Offer:

  • 💰 Competitive pay: $60/hr

  • 🕒 Flexible schedule: You choose your hours (daytime preferred)

  • 🏥 Benefits: Health insurance available for qualifying employees

  • 🌴 Paid holidays: Enjoy time off with paid holidays included

  • 📈 Career growth: Opportunity to increase hours and grow within our mission-driven team

🧠 Key Responsibilities:

  • Conduct diagnostic assessments and evaluations

  • Create and manage individualized behavior intervention plans

  • Deliver direct ABA therapy and monitor client progress

  • Collaborate with families and interdisciplinary professionals

  • Maintain accurate, HIPAA-compliant documentation

  • Stay current with ABA research and best practices

✅ Qualifications:

  • Tennessee LBA license (required)

  • BCBA certification (in good standing)

  • Experience working with children with autism or developmental disabilities

  • Strong understanding of ABA principles and assessment tools

  • Excellent communication and documentation skills

  • Compassionate, reliable, and client-focused

📅 Schedule:

  • Flexible daytime hours

  • Day shifts, Monday to Friday

  • Start part-time (5–25 hours/week) with potential to scale up

Ready to Make a Difference?
Join Open Doors ABA and help shape brighter futures for children while building a career that works for your lifestyle. Apply today!

Job Type: Part-time
Pay: $60/hr
Location: Remote (must be licensed in Tennessee)

#FinniHealth2025

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
Open Doors ABA
Full-time, Mon-Fri 8am-3pm in Bellevue, TN

*Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of children with autism and looking for a rewarding career in ABA therapy? Open Doors ABA is hiring dedicated RBTs to join our supportive and dynamic team!

What We Offer:

  • Competitive pay starting at $24 - $27 per hour

  • Supervision towards BCBA/BCaBA certifications

  • Health Insurance

  • Flexible scheduling tailored to you

  • Opportunities for growth within our expanding company

About the Role:
As an RBT with Open Doors ABA, you’ll work closely with children and their families, providing compassionate and effective behavior therapy. You’ll have the support of a skilled clinical team and structured supervision to help you succeed and grow in your role.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Implement individualized ABA treatment plans under BCBA supervision

  • Track client progress and record accurate session notes

  • Engage with children in fun, educational activities to foster growth and learning

Qualifications:

  • RBT Certification

  • Passionate, dependable, and committed to positive client outcomes

Join a team that values your dedication and offers opportunities for career development. Apply today to open doors to a brighter future at Open Doors ABA!

Benefits:

  • Competitive pay with opportunities for bonuses.

  • Ongoing training and supervision by experienced BCBAs.

  • Flexible scheduling.

  • Supportive work environment with opportunities for career growth.

How to Apply:
If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of children and are committed to providing excellent ABA services, we encourage you to apply! Thank you!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $24.00 - $27.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift

  • Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

  • Are you available to work full-time, M-F from 8am-3pm?

License/Certification:

  • RBT Certification (Required)

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Remote BCBA/BCaBA - New York
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Full-Time Early Childhood BCBA/BCaBA

Join Our Growing Team and Make a Significant Impact!

We're seeking a passionate and skilled full-time Early Childhood BCBA/BCaBA to join our dynamic team! We are dedicated to supporting neurodivergent children through Naturalistic Developmental Behavioral Interventions (NDBI) and collaborative, family-centered approaches.


Why Choose Full-Time with Finni?

  • Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy paid health insurance, paid time off, 401(k) with matching, and more.

  • Career Growth: Access abundant clinical and professional support, continuing education, and mentorship.

  • Family-Friendly Culture: We understand and support working parents, offering flexible arrangements and compassionate leave.

  • Meaningful Impact: Provide vital ABA services to young children in home, school, and community settings.

  • Collaborative Environment: Work within a supportive team dedicated to the highest standard of care.

Key Responsibilities (Full-Time):

  • Conduct functional behavior assessments (FBA) and develop behavior intervention plans (BIP).

  • Implement behavior plans and provide ongoing monitoring and evaluation.

  • Provide direct behavior intervention services in various settings.

  • Collaborate with families, caregivers, and other professionals.

  • Provide training and support to parents and caregivers.

  • Maintain accurate records and data collection.

  • Participate in team meetings and case consultations.

Qualifications:

  • Master's or bachelor's degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Psychology, Education, or related field.

  • Current BCBA or BCaBA certification from the BACB.

  • Experience in early childhood development and education.

  • Knowledge of ABA principles and NDBI.

  • Strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.

Benefits (Full-Time):

  • Paid health insurance.

  • Paid time off.

  • 401(k)

  • Dental insurance.

  • Vision insurance.

  • Continuing education credits.

  • Professional development assistance.

  • Referral program.

  • Flexible schedule.


Compensation Package:

  • Salary ($40-$80/hour equivalent)


Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

  • Evening shift

  • Monday to Friday


License/Certification:

  • BCBA or BCaBA certification (Required).


Work Location:

  • Remote

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: ABA Behavior Technician
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Are you looking to make a difference in a child with autism's life? If so, apply to join our team! We have several part-time roles are the Midland area and we offer flexible schedules!

As a Behavior Technician, you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Work closely with BCBAs and help build the best treatment plans

  • Attend team meetings as designated to share your weekly experience, collaborate with other team members and provide feedback for how we can improve

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Mental Health days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within child care

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Proof of completion of a 40-hour Behavior Technician training course

  • Pass RBT Certification within 90 days of hire (we will help you study)

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are at Finni Health

We believe in making therapy a fun and enjoyable experience for kiddos. Our highly trained therapists use creative and engaging activities tailored to your child's interests, turning each session into an exciting adventure. We celebrate every achievement along the way, providing positive reinforcement to motivate and build confidence.

We meticulously personalize care because we understand that each child is unique. We work closely with families to set individual goals and track progress, making adjustments whenever needed. Together, we create a supportive and nurturing environment where your child can thrive and develop vital skills.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $17.00 - $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

  • Paid time off

  • Professional development assistance

  • Referral program

Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Applied behavior analysis: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Behavior Technician - ABA Therapist for Children - Indianola, Iowa
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician Job Description

Job Title: Jaybird ABA Full-Time Behavior Technician (Clinic-Based)
Location: Indianola, IA
Setting: Clinic-based, and in-home
Schedule: Monday–Friday, 7:45 am - 4:15 pm
Starting Pay: $17–$21/hour (based on experience and credentials)

Join Our Mission at Jaybird ABA empowered by Finni

At Jaybird ABA, empowered by Finni Health, our mission is to uplift and support individuals and families by increasing access to high-quality, individualized ABA services. We empower children to confidently navigate their world—honoring their voices, choices, and potential.

We envision a world where neurodivergent and special needs children are celebrated for who they are. By partnering with families and communities, we create inclusive, compassionate spaces where every child has the chance to shine.

If you’re kind, dependable, and passionate about helping kids grow, we’d love to meet you.

What You’ll Do

This role primarily provides services in our clinic, with the possibility of in-home assignments based on client needs.

  • Deliver 1:1 ABA therapy to children, in-clinic or in-home, under BCBA supervision

  • Follow treatment plans to build communication, self-help, play, and social skills

  • Collect session data and submit clear, timely notes

  • Support toileting, hygiene, feeding, and other daily living skills

  • Assist with assessments, progress monitoring, and reports

  • Create and organize learning materials and visual supports

  • Collaborate professionally with families, teachers, and team members

  • Build rapport with families while maintaining professional boundaries

  • Communicate concerns or needs to supervisors promptly

  • Help maintain a clean, safe, organized clinic environment and assist with non-clinical tasks

  • Uphold all policies, ethics, and confidentiality standards

  • Participate in ongoing training, supervision, and team meetings

  • Show up each day with a caring, energetic, solutions-focused attitude

  • Perform other duties as assigned to support our mission

What We Offer

  • Competitive Compensation

  • Predictable 8am-4pm Monday-Friday schedule at a clinic

  • 100% reimbursement for your Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) course, application and exam for RBT certification

  • Health, Dental and Vision Insurance

  • Short Term Disability insurance

  • Generous PTO + Paid Holidays

  • 401(k) program

  • A supportive team that lives our values: Connect, Empower, Inspire Joy, Communicate, Learn, Grow

  • Growth pathways into lead tech or administrative roles

What You’ll Need

  • High school diploma or equivalent (Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree a plus)

  • Experience working with children or individuals with special needs

  • Enthusiasm for learning and helping others

  • Ability to become a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) within 90 days (we’ll help you!)

  • CPR certification (or willingness to obtain)

  • Reliable transportation to our Indianola clinic and to client homes

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to sit, stand, squat, and move around comfortably throughout the day

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds as needed

The Spirit of the Jaybird

Our team is guided by six core values:
Connect. Empower. Inspire Joy. Communicate. Learn. Grow.
These values show up in everything we do—from our interactions with kids and families to how we support one another as teammates.

Job Type: Full-time
Work Location: On-site
Starting Pay: $17.00–$21.00 per hour
Benefits:
 ✓ Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
✓ Paid Holidays
✓ 60 Hours PTO/Sick Time
✓ Paid Training & Certification
✓ Career Growth Pathways

Apply today to become part of a team that’s reimagining what compassionate, quality autism care looks like—one child, one family, one Jaybird at a time.

What is a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)?

A Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) is a paraprofessional who works directly with children or individuals receiving Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services. RBTs implement treatment plans developed by a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA), focusing on teaching skills, reducing challenging behaviors, and improving quality of life.

RBTs are not therapists in the traditional sense—they are hands-on educators and behavior change agents, working at the heart of client progress.

What does an RBT do day-to-day in an ABA clinic?

The job is active, structured, and deeply client-focused. Here’s what a typical day looks like:

  • Work 1:1 with a client. You’ll spend your shift with one child at a time, running therapy sessions in a clinic environment. Sessions are usually 2–4 hours.

  • Implement a treatment plan. Use specific teaching techniques, like discrete trial teaching, natural environment training, or task analysis, all outlined in the BCBA’s plan.

  • Teach new skills. This might include communication, play, social interaction, daily living skills, or coping strategies.

  • Collect data. RBTs are responsible for taking precise, ongoing data on everything they teach and observe.

  • Manage challenging behaviors. You’ll be trained to use safe, ethical strategies to reduce harmful or disruptive behaviors.

  • Collaborate. Regular check-ins with the BCBA to review progress, refine goals, and improve how sessions are run.

  • Prepare materials, clean up, and reset. Sessions need preparation and follow-through to keep things organized and effective.

RBT work is fast-paced, physically active (you may be on the floor, moving, playing, redirecting), and mentally engaging. It’s also emotionally rewarding—you’ll see kids hit milestones and gain independence because of your efforts.

How do you become an RBT?

The RBT credential is administered by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB). You do not need prior experience to start—but you do need a strong work ethic, patience, and willingness to learn.

Step-by-step:

  1. Be at least 18 years old.

  2. Have a high school diploma or equivalent.

  3. Complete 40 hours of RBT training.

    1. This covers ABA principles, ethics, data collection, teaching strategies, and behavior reduction techniques.

    2. Many employers (including us) offer this training for free or as part of onboarding.

  4. Pass a competency assessment.

    1. A BCBA will watch you demonstrate the skills you learned and sign off.

  5. Pass the RBT exam.

    1. A 75-question multiple-choice exam administered at a testing center.

  6. Get listed on the BACB registry.

  7. Once certified, you’ll maintain your credential by completing annual renewal requirements and ongoing supervision.

Is this role for you?

RBT work is an excellent fit if you:

  • Enjoy working with kids in a structured, play-based way.

  • Are patient, positive, and unafraid of challenges.

  • Want a meaningful job with real impact on families.

  • Are looking for a growth path—many RBTs go on to become BCBAs.

Jaybird ABA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

  • Teach new skills. This might include communication, play, social interaction, daily living skills, or coping strategies.

  • Collect data. RBTs are responsible for taking precise, ongoing data on everything they teach and observe.

  • Manage challenging behaviors. You’ll be trained to use safe, ethical strategies to reduce harmful or disruptive behaviors.

  • Collaborate. Regular check-ins with the BCBA to review progress, refine goals, and improve how sessions are run.

  • Prepare materials, clean up, and reset. Sessions need preparation and follow-through to keep things organized and effective.

RBT work is fast-paced, physically active (you may be on the floor, moving, playing, redirecting), and mentally engaging. It’s also emotionally rewarding—you’ll see kids hit milestones and gain independence because of your efforts.

How do you become an RBT?

The RBT credential is administered by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB). You do not need prior experience to start—but you do need a strong work ethic, patience, and willingness to learn.

Step-by-step:

  1. Be at least 18 years old.

  2. Have a high school diploma or equivalent.

  3. Complete 40 hours of RBT training.

    1. This covers ABA principles, ethics, data collection, teaching strategies, and behavior reduction techniques.

    2. Many employers (including us) offer this training for free or as part of onboarding.

  4. Pass a competency assessment.

    1. A BCBA will watch you demonstrate the skills you learned and sign off.

  5. Pass the RBT exam.

    1. A 75-question multiple-choice exam administered at a testing center.

  6. Get listed on the BACB registry.

  7. Once certified, you’ll maintain your credential by completing annual renewal requirements and ongoing supervision.

Is this role for you?

RBT work is an excellent fit if you:

  • Enjoy working with kids in a structured, play-based way.

  • Are patient, positive, and unafraid of challenges.

  • Want a meaningful job with real impact on families.

  • Are looking for a growth path—many RBTs go on to become BCBAs.

Jaybird ABA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

WHAT IS A REGISTERED BEHAVIOR TECHNICIAN (RBT)?

A Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) is a paraprofessional who works directly with children or individuals receiving Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services. RBTs implement treatment plans developed by a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA), focusing on teaching skills, reducing challenging behaviors, and improving quality of life.

RBTs are not therapists in the traditional sense—they are hands-on educators and behavior change agents, working at the heart of client progress.


WHAT DOES AN RBT DO DAY-TO-DAY IN AN ABA CLINIC?

The job is active, structured, and deeply client-focused. Here’s what a typical day looks like:

 - Work 1:1 with a client. You’ll spend your shift with one child at a time, running therapy sessions in a clinic environment. Sessions are usually 2–4 hours.

 - Implement a treatment plan. Use specific teaching techniques, like discrete trial teaching, natural environment training, or task analysis, all outlined in the BCBA’s plan.

 - Teach new skills. This might include communication, play, social interaction, daily living skills, or coping strategies.

 - Collect data. RBTs are responsible for taking precise, ongoing data on everything they teach and observe.

 - Manage challenging behaviors. You’ll be trained to use safe, ethical strategies to reduce harmful or disruptive behaviors.

 - Collaborate. Regular check-ins with the BCBA to review progress, refine goals, and improve how sessions are run.

 - Prepare materials, clean up, and reset. Sessions need preparation and follow-through to keep things organized and effective.

RBT work is fast-paced, physically active (you may be on the floor, moving, playing, redirecting), and mentally engaging. It’s also emotionally rewarding—you’ll see kids hit milestones and gain independence because of your efforts.


HOW DO YOU BECOME AN RBT?

The RBT credential is administered by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB). You do not need prior experience to start—but you do need a strong work ethic, patience, and willingness to learn.

Step-by-step:

 1. Be at least 18 years old.

 2. Have a high school diploma or equivalent.

 3. Complete 40 hours of RBT training.
    
    1. This covers ABA principles, ethics, data collection, teaching strategies, and behavior reduction techniques.
    
    2. Many employers (including us) offer this training for free or as part of onboarding.

 4. Pass a competency assessment.
    
    1. A BCBA will watch you demonstrate the skills you learned and sign off.

 5. Pass the RBT exam.
    
    1. A 75-question multiple-choice exam administered at a testing center.

 6. Get listed on the BACB registry.

 7. Once certified, you’ll maintain your credential by completing annual renewal requirements and ongoing supervision.


IS THIS ROLE FOR YOU?

RBT work is an excellent fit if you:

 - Enjoy working with kids in a structured, play-based way.

 - Are patient, positive, and unafraid of challenges.

 - Want a meaningful job with real impact on families.

 - Are looking for a growth path—many RBTs go on to become BCBAs.

jobs.title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) – Part-Time

Location: Mt. Juliet, TN (Home-Based Client)
Schedule: M–F | ~25–28 hours/week | Flexible Daytime Hours
Pay: $26–$30/hour

At Open Doors ABA, we believe every child deserves the opportunity to reach their full potential. We're a locally owned and community-rooted ABA therapy provider focused on delivering compassionate, evidence-based care that puts children and families first.

We're seeking a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) to support a teenage client with complex behavioral needs. This is a high-impact, hands-on role where your experience, consistency, and calm presence will help a client build critical skills in communication, regulation, and daily functioning.

What You’ll Do

  • Deliver individualized ABA therapy in the client’s home under BCBA supervision

  • Support the client through structured activities designed to build communication, learning, and social skills

  • Apply behavior management strategies during moments of intensity with professionalism and care

  • Record clear and accurate session notes to support data-informed treatment decisions

  • Communicate regularly with clinical supervisors to ensure quality of care

What We’re Looking For

  • Active RBT certification (required)

  • Experience supporting clients with challenging behaviors

  • Dependable, calm, and committed to long-term progress

  • Comfortable working independently in a home-based setting

  • Available to work 25–28 hours/week, Monday through Friday

Why Join Open Doors ABA?

  • Competitive pay: $26–$30/hour

  • Flexible schedule

  • BCBA/BCaBA supervision available (if pursuing certification)

  • Growth opportunities within a values-driven, community-focused team

  • Direct support from experienced clinicians who care about your success

Join us in making a meaningful impact — not just in therapy sessions, but in the lives of the families we serve. At Open Doors ABA, we’re not just delivering services — we’re building pathways to a brighter future.

#FinniHealth2025

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Registered Behavior Technician - Full-time in Clinic
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location: Newport News, VA

Compensation: $27.00/hour

Schedule: Clinic hours are 9:00am to 6:00pm.

Employment Type: Full-time (30+ hours per week)

Work Environment: Clinic Setting

Essential Functions for ABA Therapist

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Work 1-1 with clients following individualized ABA treatment plans for children/adults with autism in a clinic setting with potential for some in-home sessions.

  • Teach clients to acquire language, academic, social, and self-help skills under the supervision of a BCBA treatment plan

  • Implement programs and skills that are centered around helping the client reach their full potential Assist in creating new client projects and materials

  • Provide the client’s families with parent training to expand the client’s advancement opportunities. Have ongoing support and supervision in the field by BCBA level staff.

  • Assists in designing and implementing behavior analytic programming as it relates to “ABA-Verbal Behavior” skill acquisition and behavior management programming

  • Assists in creating, developing, and monitoring individualized programming

  • Maintains reliable and consistent schedules with families

  • Ensures requirements for documentation of clinical services are implemented

  • Adherence to BACB guidelines for ethical conduct.

  • Other duties as assigned.

Required Education and Experience

  • 1+ years’ previous experience working with children with developmental disabilities, behavioral issues, or related field.

  • Must hold an RBT credential from the BACB

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Excellent time management skills with experience managing a caseload.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

  • Strong commitment to providing quality behavior analytic programming.

  • Enthusiastic, self-motivated to teach and learn more about Applied Behavior Analysis.

  • Enthusiastic and great desire to work to with children diagnosed with autism

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

License/Certification:

  • CPR Certification (Required within 30 days of hire)

  • RBT Certification (Required prior to start date)


Benefits

  • Dental insurance

  • Health insurance

  • Paid time off

  • Professional development assistance

  • Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

 - Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

 - Strong commitment to providing quality behavior analytic programming.

 - Enthusiastic, self-motivated to teach and learn more about Applied Behavior Analysis.

 - Enthusiastic and great desire to work to with children diagnosed with autism

 - To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

 - Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

 - CPR Certification (Required within 30 days of hire)

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician (Part-Time) – Lorain, OH
Hours:

  • Tues- Fri from 3pm-6pm; Possibility of Mondays 5pm-8pm

SparkJoy ABA, in partnership with Finni Health, is seeking a compassionate and motivated Behavior Technician to provide in-home ABA therapy to children with autism in Lorain, OH.

Why Join Us?
We’re a mission-driven, clinician-led company focused on ethical care and meaningful outcomes—not investor pressure. Enjoy free advanced training, ongoing BCBA support, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact.

Your Role:

  • Work 1:1 with children in-home using individualized ABA treatment plans

  • Teach communication, daily living, and social skills

  • Collect data and collaborate with supervising BCBAs

  • Support families through parent training and consistent communication

  • Work Environment - This job operates in a client's home environment. Employees must feel comfortable going into client homes and neighborhoods within the assigned territory.

What You Bring:

  • 1+ year experience with children with autism or developmental disabilities

  • Strong communication, time management, and organizational skills

  • A passion for helping children grow and succeed

  • Reliable transportation to client homes in Wadsworth

Job Details:

  • Part-time: 12-15 hours/week

  • Pay: $17–$22/hr

  • Benefits: PTO, professional development

Join a company that values people over profit. SparkJoy ABA is changing lives—one session at a time.

Apply today and spark joy in a child’s life.

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Behavior Technician (RBT) - Salisbury, NC
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Are you looking to make a difference in a child with autisms life? If so, apply to join our team! We have part-time role open in the Salisbury area!

As a Behavior Technician you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Work closely with BCBAs and help build the best treatment plans

  • Attend team meetings as designated to share your weekly experience, collaborate with other team members and provide feedback for how we can improve

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Mental Health days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within child care

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Proof of completion of a 40-hour Behavior Technician training course

  • Pass RBT Certification within 90 days of hire (we will help you study)

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are at Finni Health

We believe in making therapy a fun and enjoyable experience for kiddos. Our highly trained therapists use creative and engaging activities tailored to your child's interests, turning each session into an exciting adventure. We celebrate every achievement along the way, providing positive reinforcement to motivate and build confidence.

We meticulously personalize care because we understand that each child is unique. We work closely with families to set individual goals and track progress, making adjustments whenever needed. Together, we create a supportive and nurturing environment where your child can thrive and develop vital skills.

Job Types: Part-time

Pay: $21.00 - $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

  • Paid time off

  • Professional development assistance

  • Referral program

Schedule:

  • Monday-Friday 1pm-5pm

Experience:

  • Applied behavior analysis: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: ABA Behavior Technician
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Full-Time Behavior Technician – Mt. Pleasant, MI

Are you looking to make a meaningful difference in the life of a child with autism? If so, we’d love for you to join our team at Finni Health! We are currently hiring full-time Behavior Technicians in the Mt. Pleasant area. This is an opportunity to build a rewarding career with a flexible schedule, supportive team, and impactful work.

About the Role

As a Behavior Technician, you will work one-on-one with children in their home setting, implementing life-changing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy under the guidance of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA). You’ll help children learn essential life skills, reach developmental milestones, and celebrate every success along the way.

Responsibilities

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in the child’s home

  • Collect and record accurate data on behaviors and skill progress

  • Collaborate closely with BCBAs to help build and carry out effective treatment plans

  • Attend team meetings to share insights, collaborate, and continuously improve care

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay: $17.00 – $22.00 per hour, based on experience

  • Paid training and ongoing professional development

  • Full-time schedule with flexible hours

  • PTO and designated Mental Health Days

  • Mileage reimbursement

  • Growth opportunities within the company

  • Support in preparing for and completing the RBT certification

Requirements

  • High school diploma or equivalent required (ideal for those pursuing a career in child care or special education)

  • Experience working with children, especially those with special needs, is highly preferred

  • Reliable transportation to and from client homes

  • Proof of completion of a 40-hour Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) training course

At Finni Health, we make therapy fun, personalized, and engaging. Our therapists use creative approaches tailored to each child’s interests, helping turn sessions into exciting adventures. jobs.title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) - Las Vegas, NV
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Full-Time Early Childhood BCBA


Join Our Growing Team!


Finni Health is seeking a passionate, skilled, and dedicated full-time Early Childhood BCBA to join our dynamic team. We are committed to supporting neurodivergent children and their families through Naturalistic Developmental Behavioral Interventions (NDBI) and a collaborative, family-centered approach.


Why Choose Finni?


  • Comprehensive Benefits: Paid health insurance, paid time off, 401(k) with matching, and more.

  • Career Growth: Access to robust clinical and professional support, continuing education opportunities, and mentorship programs.

  • Family-Friendly Culture: We support working parents with flexible work arrangements and compassionate leave policies.

  • Meaningful Impact: Deliver vital ABA services to young children in home, school, and community settings, making a real difference in their lives.

  • Collaborative Environment: Be part of a supportive team dedicated to the highest standards of care.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Conduct functional behavior assessments (FBA) and develop individualized behavior intervention plans (BIP).

  • Implement and monitor behavior plans, providing ongoing evaluation and adjustment as needed.

  • Deliver direct behavior intervention services across home, school, and community settings.

  • Collaborate closely with families, caregivers, and interdisciplinary professionals.

  • Provide training and support to parents and caregivers to promote positive outcomes.

  • Maintain thorough documentation, including accurate records and data collection.

  • Participate in team meetings and case consultations to ensure comprehensive, quality care.


Qualifications:


  • Master’s degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Psychology, Education, or a related field.

  • Current BCBA certification from the BACB.

  • Experience in early childhood development and education is strongly preferred.

  • In-depth knowledge of ABA principles and NDBI.

  • Strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.


Compensation Package:


  • Hourly Rate: $65–$75 per hour


Schedule:


  • Monday–Friday


License/Certification:


  • BCBA certification (Required)


Work Location:


  • Las Vegas, NV


To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with final confirmation to start pending satisfactory screening results.


#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Paid BCBA Intern
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Behavior Analyst (BA) Candidate – Supervision & Indirect Hours Provided!

Location: Santa Fe, NM
Company: Sun and Sage ABA
Type: Part-time with potential to work up to Full-time
Hours: Flexible daytime hours
Compensation: $35.00 - $45.00 per hour (Competitive hourly pay + paid indirect hours)
Supervision Hours: Yes – provided at no cost

Join Our Team at Sun and Sage ABA!
Are you almost done with your BCBA certification and looking for a supportive, inspiring place to grow? We’re hiring a Behavior Analyst (BA) Candidate to join our passionate team in Santa Fe! This role is perfect for individuals who’ve completed their master’s degree and ABA coursework and are working on their supervised experience hours. We’ll provide high-quality supervision, paid indirect time, and mentorship to help you thrive.

Learn more about us at www.sunandsageaba.com

Perks We Offer:
Paid indirect hours (yes, you get paid for report writing, planning, and data review!)
Weekly supervision hours toward your BCBA certification
Flexible scheduling that supports your work-life balance
Opportunities to grow into a full BCBA role after certification
A compassionate, client-centered work environment
Supportive team culture with real-time mentorship

PTO,Sick leave, and Holiday Pay

What is a BA Candidate?
A BA Candidate is someone who:
Has a master’s degree in a BACB-approved field
Completed all required ABA coursework
Finished at least 50% of supervised experience hours
Is planning to sit for the BCBA exam within one year of starting
Has completed New Mexico's background check registry
Can provide Stage 2 (Assessment) and Stage 3 (Intervention) ABA services under supervision

What You’ll Do:

  • Support clients by developing and implementing individualized treatment plans

  • Work directly with clients and model strategies for technicians and caregivers

  • Collect and analyze data to guide progress

  • Collaborate with families, schools, and other professionals

  • Attend team meetings and receive structured supervision

  • Maintain documentation that’s ethical, accurate, and HIPAA-compliant

What We’re Looking For:
Someone who is motivated to become a BCBA within the next year
A passion for helping individuals with autism and developmental needs
Strong understanding of ABA principles and data collection
Great communication skills and a collaborative attitude
Commitment to ethical, culturally respectful care

We’d love to support you on your BCBA journey!
Apply today and join a team that’s just as dedicated to your growth as you are to your clients.

Visit us at www.sunandsageaba.com to learn more about who we are and what we stand for!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $35.00 - $45.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 25 per week

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: ABA Behavior Technician
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Are you looking to make a difference in a child with autisms life? If so, apply to join our team! We have several part-time roles are the Midland area and we offer flexible scheduled!

As a Behavior Technician you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Work closely with BCBAs and help build the best treatment plans

  • Attend team meetings as designated to share your weekly experience, collaborate with other team members and provide feedback for how we can improve

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Mental Health days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within child care

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Proof of completion of a 40-hour Behavior Technician training course

  • Pass RBT Certification within 90 days of hire (we will help you study)

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are at Finni Health

We believe in making therapy a fun and enjoyable experience for kiddos. Our highly trained therapists use creative and engaging activities tailored to your child's interests, turning each session into an exciting adventure. We celebrate every achievement along the way, providing positive reinforcement to motivate and build confidence.

We meticulously personalize care because we understand that each child is unique. We work closely with families to set individual goals and track progress, making adjustments whenever needed. Together, we create a supportive and nurturing environment where your child can thrive and develop vital skills.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $17.00 - $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

  • Paid time off

  • Professional development assistance

  • Referral program

Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Applied behavior analysis: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

#FinniHealth2025

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician (Part-Time) – Amherst, OH (Daycare setting)
Hours:

  • M/W 6:30am-4:30pm T/Th/F 9am-11am. On M/W- 12:30-2:30 break for nap time.

SparkJoy ABA, in partnership with Finni Health, is seeking a compassionate and motivated Behavior Technician to provide ABA therapy to children with autism in a daycare setting in Amherst, OH.

Why Join Us?
We’re a mission-driven, clinician-led company focused on ethical care and meaningful outcomes—not investor pressure. Enjoy free advanced training, ongoing BCBA support, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact.

Your Role:

  • Work 1:1 with children in-home using individualized ABA treatment plans

  • Teach communication, daily living, and social skills

  • Collect data and collaborate with supervising BCBAs

  • Support families through parent training and consistent communication

  • Work Environment - This job operates in a client's home environment. Employees must feel comfortable going into client homes and neighborhoods within the assigned territory.

  • Strong communication, time management, and organizational skills

  • A passion for helping children grow and succeed

  • Reliable transportation

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician/Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) – Part-Time
Location: Cheshire, CT
Compensation: $21 - $27/hour
Hours: 10 hours per week
Schedule: M-F 4pm-6pm

Position Overview

Arc Light Behavioral Health Collective (www.arclightbhc.com) is a small BCBA-owned company seeking a dedicated and compassionate Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) to provide in-home Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to clients in Waterbury, CT. This role involves working one-on-one with children and adolescents diagnosed with autism and other developmental disabilities, implementing behavior intervention plans, and supporting skill development under the supervision of a Board-Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA). We pride ourselves on our approach to treatment that centers around the individual and supports the family.

Our company exceeds supervision requirements for RBTs and offers BCBA candidate supervision, specializing in unrestricted hours, as an employment benefit. We feel that the collaboration between the BCBAs and those we supervise is what makes our company special. If you are interested in individualized or group supervision, or in speaking with our current supervisees, please reach out.

Essential Functions

  • Implement individualized ABA treatment plans for children and adolescents in a home setting under the guidance of a BCBA

  • Support behavior management strategies, ensuring consistency and adherence to treatment plans

  • Supervise community outings and run objectives in real- world settings

  • Assist in creating client materials to support intervention goals

  • Provide parent training and collaborate with families to reinforce learning and progress

  • Maintain accurate data collection and timely documentation of clinical services

  • Work with clients who have a history of aggression and elopement (though rarely engage in it) and demonstrate confidence in managing challenging behaviors

  • Maintain a reliable and consistent schedule with families to ensure effective therapy implementation

  • Follow BACB ethical guidelines and company policies

  • Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications & Requirements

  • Active RBT certification (preferred)

  • Minimum one year of experience working with children or adolescents with developmental disabilities, behavioral challenges, or related fields

  • Strong time management skills and ability to manage a caseload efficiently

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • High level of organization, attention to detail, and professionalism

  • Passion for helping children and adolescents reach their full potential

  • Ability to work independently in-home with minimal supervision

Competencies

  • Accuracy – Consistently records and calculates data correctly

  • Customer Service – Provides quality service, responds to feedback, and meets commitments

  • Organization – Maintains effective time management and use of resources

  • Learning Orientation – Demonstrates willingness to grow professionally and stay up to date on ABA best practices

  • Flexibility – Adapts to changing client needs and schedules

  • Ethical Conduct – Upholds company and BACB ethical standards

  • Problem Solving – Uses critical thinking to address client needs effectively

  • Collaboration – Works well with families, supervisors, and other team members

  • Communication – Clearly communicates with clients, families, and colleagues

Work Environment & Physical Demands

  • This job operates in a client home environment – employees must be comfortable working in various home settings

  • Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs, bend, stoop, reach, and move comfortably in client homes

Employment Terms

  • Position with a flexible schedule based on client needs

  • Employment is at-will, and responsibilities may change as needed

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $21.00 - $27.00 per hour - we believe in pay transparency

Expected hours: 10 per week

Benefits:

  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

  • Evening shift

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
BehaveAbility, LLC is hiring a part-time Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) or Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst (BCaBA) to join our team and provide high-quality ABA services in-home and school-based settings. This is an impactful role serving St. Louis County and St. Charles County, MO.

Location: St. Louis County and St. Charles County
Schedule: Monday through Friday, afternoon and evening availability required
Job Type: Full-time (30+ hours per week)
Starting Pay: $65 per hour or commensurate with experience

Key Responsibilities:

  • Conduct intake assessments and develop individualized treatment plans

  • Provide 1:1 behavioral therapy in school settings, with the possibility of in-home or community-based sessions as needed

  • Monitor client progress and modify intervention plans accordingly

  • Collaborate with families, school staff, and interdisciplinary teams

  • Maintain accurate, HIPAA-compliant documentation

Qualifications:

  • BCBA or BCaBA certification preferred

  • Missouri Behavior Analyst Licensure required; provisional licensure will be considered

  • Experience providing ABA therapy for children

  • Strong communication, clinical, and collaboration skills

  • Reliable transportation for travel to school sites

Benefits for Employees Working 30+ Hours Per Week:

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance (after 90 days)

  • 10 paid time off (PTO) days per year, plus sick leave accrual

  • Paid holidays, including Martin Luther King Jr. Day, Juneteenth, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and more

  • Mileage reimbursement and a $25 biweekly travel stipend



#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Behavior Technician
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician (Part-Time) – Canal Fulton, OH
Hours:

  • Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday from 3:30pm-7:00pm

SparkJoy ABA, in partnership with Finni Health, is seeking a compassionate and motivated Behavior Technician to provide in-home ABA therapy to children with autism in Canal Fulton, OH.

Why Join Us?
We’re a mission-driven, clinician-led company focused on ethical care and meaningful outcomes—not investor pressure. Enjoy free advanced training, ongoing BCBA support, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact.

Your Role:

  • Work 1:1 with children in-home using individualized ABA treatment plans

  • Teach communication, daily living, and social skills

  • Collect data and collaborate with supervising BCBAs

  • Support families through parent training and consistent communication

  • Work Environment - This job operates in a client's home environment. Employees must feel comfortable going into client homes and neighborhoods within the assigned territory.

What You Bring:

  • 1+ year experience with children with autism or developmental disabilities

  • Strong communication, time management, and organizational skills

  • A passion for helping children grow and succeed

  • Reliable transportation to client homes in Ashland

Job Details:

  • Part-time: 15 hours/week

  • Pay: $17–$22/hr

  • Benefits: PTO, professional development

Join a company that values people over profit. SparkJoy ABA is changing lives—one session at a time.

Apply today and spark joy in a child’s life.

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Behavior Technician
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician (BT/RBT) –Jackson, TN
Company: KB Behavioral Health, a Finni Health company
Job Type: Part-time or Full-time
Location: In-person – Jackson, TN
Pay: $20.00 – $25.00 per hour

About the Role

KB Behavioral Health, a Finni Health company, is seeking a dedicated and compassionate Behavior Technician (BT/RBT) to join our team in Jackson, TN. In this role, you will work one-on-one with children in their homes, using Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy techniques under the supervision of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to make a meaningful impact on their development and daily life.

We are currently hiring for part-time afternoon hours only.

Schedule

  • Monday – Friday: Between the hours of 8am and 6:30pm

What You'll Do

  • Deliver in-person ABA therapy in a child's home

  • Follow behavior intervention plans designed by a BCBA

  • Collect and record data on client progress and behaviors

  • Participate in supervision sessions with a BCBA

  • Attend required team meetings and training sessions

What We Offer

  • Competitive hourly pay: $20–$25/hour

  • Training and support to obtain RBT certification

  • Career growth opportunities within the ABA field

  • PTO and sick time (part-time accrual)

  • Mileage reimbursement

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance (for full-time employees)

What You'll Need

  • High school diploma or equivalent

  • Experience working with children

  • Passion for supporting children with special needs

  • Reliable transportation

  • Active CPR certification (Required)

  • RBT certification (Preferred) or willingness to obtain it within a set timeframe

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Ability to kneel, squat, crawl, sit, and stand for extended periods

  • Comfortable engaging in play and physical activity with children

About Us – KB Behavioral Health, a Finni Health Company

KB Behavioral Health partners with Finni Health to provide compassionate, in-home ABA therapy. Finni Health supports local BCBAs and technicians with tools, training, and operational excellence to deliver high-quality care to families in their communities. Together, we are redefining how autism care is delivered—one child at a time.

Application Questions

  • Are you located within a 45-minute commute of Jackson, TN?

License/Certification

  • CPR Certification (Preferred)

  • RBT Certification (Preferred)

Background Check

All candidates must pass a background check. Employment offers are contingent upon successful screening results to ensure the safety of the children and families we serve.
