jobs.title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hybrid Early Childhood BCBA/BCaBA

Join Our Growing Team and Make a Significant Impact!

We're seeking a passionate and skilled full-time or part-time Early Childhood BCBA/BCaBA to join our dynamic team in Hoover, Alabama! We are dedicated to supporting neurodivergent children through Naturalistic Developmental Behavioral Interventions (NDBI) and collaborative, family-centered approaches.


Why Choose Full-Time with Finni?

  • Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy paid health insurance, paid time off and 401(k) for eligible employees

  • Career Growth: Access abundant clinical and professional support, continuing education, and mentorship.

  • Family-Friendly Culture: We understand and support working parents, offering flexible arrangements and compassionate leave.

  • Meaningful Impact: Provide vital ABA services to young children in home, school, and community settings.

  • Collaborative Environment: Work within a supportive team dedicated to the highest standard of care.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Conduct functional behavior assessments (FBA) and develop behavior intervention plans (BIP).

  • Implement behavior plans and provide ongoing monitoring and evaluation.

  • Provide direct behavior intervention services in various settings.

  • Collaborate with families, caregivers, and other professionals.

  • Provide training and support to parents and caregivers.

  • Maintain accurate records and data collection.

  • Participate in team meetings and case consultations.

Qualifications:

  • Master's or bachelor's degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Psychology, Education, or related field.

  • Current BCBA or BCaBA certification from the BACB.

  • Valid Alabama state licensure.

  • Experience in early childhood development and education.

  • Strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.

  • Ability to provide in home and community based services.

Benefits (Full-Time):

  • Paid health insurance.

  • Paid time off.

  • 401(k)

  • Dental insurance.

  • Vision insurance.

  • Continuing education credits.

  • Professional development assistance.

  • Mileage reimbursement.

  • Referral program.

  • Flexible schedule.


Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

  • Evening shift

  • Monday to Friday


License/Certification:

  • BCBA or BCaBA certification (Required).

jobs.title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Finni is looking for a part-time RBT!

As a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing ABA care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting and community

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Be available weekly for supervision by the Behavior Analyst

  • Attend team meetings

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Sick Days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within the field

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Must have an active CPR Certification

  • Must be willing to become RBT certified within specific time frame

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are At Finni Health

Finni Health empowers BCBAs to launch local in-home ABA clinics. We are bringing together world-class therapists, marketers and technology enthusiasts to build the future of autism care. Help join us change the modality of care together!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $25.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday - Friday

License/Certification:

  • CPR Certification (Required)

  • RBT Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Finance Coordinator
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Finni Health, a rapidly growing company (400% growth, approaching profitability, backed by General Catalyst), is expanding our global operations and seeking a Finance Coordinator to strengthen our finance foundation and ensure multi-state compliance. We're revolutionizing ABA clinics by helping providers grow their businesses while delivering top-tier patient care.

About the Role

As a Finance Coordinator, you’ll play a critical role in maintaining our operational integrity across states, ensuring compliance, and supporting financial accuracy. You will manage key processes including state registrations, billing audits, vendor management, and finance operations reporting. This role is ideal for someone detail-oriented, highly organized, and comfortable navigating U.S. compliance frameworks in a dynamic, fast-scaling environment.

Key Responsibilities

Financial Operations & Audit Support:

  • Download and organize compliance and financial documents in designated systems.

  • Audit vendor, software, insurance, and operational spend to ensure accuracy, policy alignment, and value realization.

  • Support reconciliations and spend validation across reports and accounting systems.

Vendor Management & Tracking:

  • Manage and maintain vendor records, including tracking invoices, plans, accountable parties, and key contract dates.

  • Track and monitor COGS and operational spends to identify and prevent potential spend leaks.

  • Monitor and coordinate vendor renewals or renegotiations to ensure timely and cost-effective outcomes.

  • Collaborate with internal teams to ensure visibility and control over expenses.

Compliance & State Registrations:

  • Contact government agencies or regulatory bodies to confirm requirements and obtain information as needed.

  • Research and maintain compliance requirements across U.S. states, including registration deadlines, renewals, and documentation.

  • Complete and submit forms for business licenses and vendor applications at local levels.

  • Maintain a comprehensive tracker of logins, registration dates, and compliance details.

Documentation & Reporting:

  • Maintain high-quality documentation across trackers and reports for internal audits and leadership visibility.

  • Support the finance and operations teams with cross-referenced data validation between invoices, reports, and accounting systems.

About You

  • Experience with U.S. compliance, licensing, or legal/regulatory processes.

  • Prior experience supporting outsourced finance or operations teams.

  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy in documentation.

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets.

  • Excellent time management and organizational skills; ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines.

  • Skilled at cross-verifying data from multiple sources (e.g., invoices, reports, vendor records).

  • Clear written communication and ability to follow structured workflows.

Bonus Points For:

  • Experience with healthcare or multi-state operational compliance.

  • Background in vendor management, finance operations, or auditing.

  • Familiarity with tools like Rippling, QuickBooks, or similar finance platforms.

Details

  • Location: Remote

  • Department: Finance

  • Reports To: Business Operations and Finance Manager

  • Compensation: Competitive, commensurate with experience

  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy in documentation.

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets.

  • Excellent time management and organizational skills; ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines.

  • Skilled at cross-verifying data from multiple sources (e.g., invoices, reports, vendor records).

  • Clear written communication and ability to follow structured workflows.

Bonus Points For:

  • Experience with healthcare or multi-state operational compliance.

  • Background in vendor management, finance operations, or auditing.

  • Familiarity with tools like Rippling, QuickBooks, or similar finance platforms.

Details

  • Location: Remote

  • Department: Finance

  • Reports To: Business Operations and Finance Manager

  • Compensation: Competitive, commensurate with experience
jobs.descriptionPlain:
Finni Health, a rapidly growing company (400% growth, approaching profitability, backed by General Catalyst), is expanding our global operations and seeking a Finance Coordinator to strengthen our finance foundation and ensure multi-state compliance. We're revolutionizing ABA clinics by helping providers grow their businesses while delivering top-tier patient care.


ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Finance Coordinator, you’ll play a critical role in maintaining our operational integrity across states, ensuring compliance, and supporting financial accuracy. You will manage key processes including state registrations, billing audits, vendor management, and finance operations reporting. This role is ideal for someone detail-oriented, highly organized, and comfortable navigating U.S. compliance frameworks in a dynamic, fast-scaling environment.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Financial Operations & Audit Support:

 - Download and organize compliance and financial documents in designated systems.

 - Audit vendor, software, insurance, and operational spend to ensure accuracy, policy alignment, and value realization.

 - Support reconciliations and spend validation across reports and accounting systems.

Vendor Management & Tracking:

 - Manage and maintain vendor records, including tracking invoices, plans, accountable parties, and key contract dates.

 - Track and monitor COGS and operational spends to identify and prevent potential spend leaks.

 - Monitor and coordinate vendor renewals or renegotiations to ensure timely and cost-effective outcomes.

 - Collaborate with internal teams to ensure visibility and control over expenses.

Compliance & State Registrations:

 - Contact government agencies or regulatory bodies to confirm requirements and obtain information as needed.

 - Research and maintain compliance requirements across U.S. states, including registration deadlines, renewals, and documentation.

 - Complete and submit forms for business licenses and vendor applications at local levels.

 - Maintain a comprehensive tracker of logins, registration dates, and compliance details.

Documentation & Reporting:

 - Maintain high-quality documentation across trackers and reports for internal audits and leadership visibility.

 - Support the finance and operations teams with cross-referenced data validation between invoices, reports, and accounting systems.


ABOUT YOU

 - Experience with U.S. compliance, licensing, or legal/regulatory processes.

 - Prior experience supporting outsourced finance or operations teams.

 - Strong attention to detail and accuracy in documentation.

 - Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets.

 - Excellent time management and organizational skills; ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines.

 - Skilled at cross-verifying data from multiple sources (e.g., invoices, reports, vendor records).

 - Clear written communication and ability to follow structured workflows.


BONUS POINTS FOR:

 - Experience with healthcare or multi-state operational compliance.

 - Background in vendor management, finance operations, or auditing.

 - Familiarity with tools like Rippling, QuickBooks, or similar finance platforms.


DETAILS

 - Location: Remote

 - Department: Finance

 - Reports To: Business Operations and Finance Manager

 - Compensation: Competitive, commensurate with experience

jobs.title: Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) – Part-Time
Location: Waterbury, CT
Compensation: $21 - $27/hour
Hours: ~15+ hours per week
Schedule: M-F 4pm-7pm

Position Overview

Arc Light Behavioral Health Collective (www.arclightbhc.com) is a small BCBA-owned company seeking a dedicated and compassionate Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) to provide in-home Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to clients in Waterbury, CT. This role involves working one-on-one with children and adolescents diagnosed with autism and other developmental disabilities, implementing behavior intervention plans, and supporting skill development under the supervision of a Board-Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA). We pride ourselves on our approach to treatment that centers around the individual and supports the family.

Our company exceeds supervision requirements for RBTs and offers BCBA candidate supervision, specializing in unrestricted hours, as an employment benefit. We feel that the collaboration between the BCBAs and those we supervise is what makes our company special. If you are interested in individualized or group supervision, or in speaking with our current supervisees please reach out.

Essential Functions

  • Implement individualized ABA treatment plans for children and adolescents in a home setting under the guidance of a BCBA

  • Support behavior management strategies, ensuring consistency and adherence to treatment plans

  • Supervise community outings and run objectives in real- world settings

  • Assist in creating client materials to support intervention goals

  • Provide parent training and collaborate with families to reinforce learning and progress

  • Maintain accurate data collection and timely documentation of clinical services

  • Work with clients who have a history of aggression and elopement (though rarely engage in it) and demonstrate confidence in managing challenging behaviors

Pay: $21.00 - $27.00 per hour - we believe in pay transparency

Expected hours: 15 per week

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance

  • Health insurance

  • Paid time off

  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

  • Evening shift

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Part-Time Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) - Durham, New Hampshire
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Are you looking to make a difference in a child with autisms life? If so, apply to join our team! We have a part-time role open in the Durham area!

As a Behavior Technician you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Work closely with BCBAs and help build the best treatment plans

  • Attend team meetings as designated to share your weekly experience, collaborate with other team members and provide feedback for how we can improve

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Mental Health days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within child care

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Proof of completion of a 40-hour Behavior Technician training course

  • Pass RBT Certification within 90 days of hire (we will help you study)

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are at Finni Health

We believe in making therapy a fun and enjoyable experience for kiddos. Our highly trained therapists use creative and engaging activities tailored to your child's interests, turning each session into an exciting adventure. We celebrate every achievement along the way, providing positive reinforcement to motivate and build confidence.

We meticulously personalize care because we understand that each child is unique. We work closely with families to set individual goals and track progress, making adjustments whenever needed. Together, we create a supportive and nurturing environment where your child can thrive and develop vital skills.

Job Types: Part-time

Schedule: Tuesday and Thursday 3:30pm-7:30pm

Pay: $25.00 - $28.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

  • Paid time off

  • Professional development assistance

  • Referral program

Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

Experience:

  • Applied behavior analysis: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: ABA Behavior Technician - Buffalo, NY
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Schedule: Afternoon/evening/weekend hours

Employment Type: Part-time, 15-30 hours/week

Pay: $20-30/hour depending on credentials and experience

Location: Buffalo, NY

Setting: In-home

Essential Functions for ABA Therapist

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Work 1-1 with clients following individualized ABA treatment plans for children/adults with autism in the home settings.

  • Teach clients to acquire language, academic, social, and self-help skills under the supervision of a BCBA treatment plan

  • Implement programs and skills that are centered around helping the client reach their full potential Assist in creating new client projects and materials

  • Provide the client’s families with parent training to expand the client’s advancement opportunities. Have ongoing support and supervision in the field by BCBA level staff.

  • Assists in designing and implementing behavior analytic programming as it relates to “ABA-Verbal Behavior” skill acquisition and behavior management programming

  • Assists in creating, developing, and monitoring individualized programming

  • Maintains reliable and consistent schedules with families

  • Ensures requirements for documentation of clinical services are implemented

  • Adherence to BACB guidelines for ethical conduct.

  • Other duties as assigned.

Required Education and Experience

1. 1+ years’ previous experience working with children with developmental disabilities, behavioral issues, or related field.

2. Excellent time management skills with experience managing a caseload.

3. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

4. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

5. Strong commitment to providing quality behavior analytic programming.

6. Enthusiastic, self-motivated to teach and learn more about Applied Behavior Analysis.

7. Enthusiastic and great desire to work to with children diagnosed with autism

Competencies

1. Accuracy- Must be able to consistently accurately calculate and record information.

2. Customer Service- Must respond promptly to customer needs. Must solicit customer feedback to improve service. Must meets commitments.

3. Organization- Must be organized for effective time management and use of resources.

4. Learning Orientation- Must have a desire and willingness to continuously learn and grow professionally; Must stay up to date on the latest changes in accounting principles and policies

5. Flexibility- Must be able and willing “wear many hats” and adapt to changing business needs as the company grows; Must be able and willing to work overtime as needed

6. Ethical Conduct- Must uphold and enforce the company’s ethical standards and comply with local, state and federal law

7. Problem Solving- Demonstrates subject matter knowledge commensurate with experience. Solves problems using multiple problem-solving tools and techniques using appropriate resources, personal knowledge and experience with whatever data are available given the situation.

8. Collaboration- Must work well with other departments/functions.

9. Communication- Must communicate effectively to employees, clients; Must speak, write and read English at the necessary level to safely and competently perform all job duties


Supervisory Responsibility

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.


Work Environment

This job operates in a client home environment. Employees must feel comfortable going into client homes and neighborhoods within assigned territory.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

This role is primarily sedentary, but is occasionally mobile. The incumbent is occasionally required to bend, stoop, reach, lift, walk and stand; and is regularly required to talk, hear, see and speak. Employees must be able to lift at least 30lbs.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a part-time or full-time position with varied hours based on client needs.

Work Authorization/Security Clearance

Must be able to legally work in the US. To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Employment Relationship

Job descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts. Finni Health maintains its status as an at will employer. Employees can be terminated for any reason not prohibited by law.


Benefits

  • Dental insurance

  • Health insurance

  • Paid time off

  • Professional development assistance

  • Vision insurance

License/Certification:

  • RBT Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) - Dunwoody, GA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Finni is looking for a part-time BT/RBT!

As a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing ABA care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting and community

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Be available weekly for supervision by the Behavior Analyst

  • Attend team meetings

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Sick Days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within the field

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Must have an active CPR Certification

  • Must be willing to become RBT certified within specific time frame

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are At Finni Health

Finni Health empowers BCBAs to launch local in-home ABA clinics. We are bringing together world-class therapists, marketers and technology enthusiasts to build the future of autism care. Help join us change the modality of care together!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance

  • Health insurance

  • Paid time off

  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Tuesday, Thursday and Friday

Application Question(s):

  • Are you located within a 30 minute commute of Dunwoody, GA or Sandy Springs, GA?

  • Are you available to work part-time, Monday and Wednesday 9:15am-12:30pm and Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday 3pm-5pm?

License/Certification:

  • CPR Certification (Required)

  • RBT Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

 - Tuesday, Thursday and Friday

 - CPR Certification (Required)

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Head of BizOps
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Finni Health is one of the fastest-growing companies in behavioral health — 300% YoY growth, approaching profitability, and backed by YCombinator, General Catalyst, and leading digital health founders.

We’re reimagining how ABA (Applied Behavior Analysis) clinics operate by providing independent providers with the tools, systems, and support they need to build thriving, patient-centered practices. Our mission is to help therapists focus on what actually matters: delivering life-changing care to kids and families.

Now we’re looking for a BizOps Generalist (Team Lead) a hybrid of strategist, operator, and builder to help us scale Finni with precision and heart.

You’ll be the connective tissue across the company: managing every operational metric, driving visibility, leading high-stakes initiatives, supporting fundraising efforts, and ensuring execution across teams. This role reports directly to leadership and plays a key part in shaping Finni’s next chapter.

What You’ll Do


📈 Drive Visibility and Performance

  • Own Finni’s operating system — define, track, and report on metrics that drive company performance.

  • Build dashboards and frameworks that keep the leadership team aligned on what’s working (and what’s not).

  • Identify blind spots before they become fires.


⚙️ Lead Operations Projects

  • Run point on the most important cross-functional projects across Clinical Operations, Finance, and Provider Success.

  • Translate strategic goals into executable plans — and make sure they actually happen.

  • Build scalable systems and playbooks for growth, margin management, and practice operations.


💡 Be the Strategic Glue

  • Partner with the CEO and leadership team to translate vision into motion.

  • Make sure information flows, accountability sticks, and Finni’s machine keeps humming.

  • Be the force that connects finance, ops, and people, and make it feel effortless.


💰 Support Fundraising and Strategic Finance

  • Support capital raises, investor materials, and board reporting with crisp data and insight.

  • Help shape the company narrative through numbers and operational storytelling.

  • Maintain a strong command of P&L visibility, gross margin tracking, and growth levers.


🚀 Build for Scale

  • Create clarity out of chaos and repeatable processes out of experiments.

  • Partner with teams to automate workflows and improve data integrity.

  • Push Finni toward being a data-driven, operationally excellent organization.


Who You Are

  • 3–6 years of experience in management consulting, BizOps, or strategy/operations at a high-growth startup.

  • Strong understanding of metrics-driven execution — you can tell a story through numbers and build dashboards that drive accountability.

  • Analytical but pragmatic — you love modeling scenarios, but you also know how to move fast and deliver.

  • A builder and operator — you can design a process in Notion or Airtable in the morning and run an exec sync by the afternoon.

  • Obsessed with clarity and alignment — you make sure people know what matters, why, and how to get it done.

  • Highly collaborative — you can partner across Finance, Product, and People while keeping momentum high.

  • Comfortable with ambiguity — you see chaos as raw material for structure.

  • Bonus: experience in healthcare, behavioral health, or other complex service operations.


Why You’ll Love Finni

  • You’ll work directly with the CEO and leadership team on high-impact projects.

  • You’ll get to shape the infrastructure of a company growing 3x year over year.

  • You’ll operate in an environment that blends mission-driven healthcare with startup velocity.

  • You’ll have a front-row seat to scaling a company backed by one of the world’s top venture firms.

Finni Health is where operators come to build something that truly matters — a company improving care for families while rewriting what a healthcare startup can look like.

jobs.title: Nepali-speaking Behavior Technician
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Behavior Technician (Part-Time, Nepali-Speaking Required) – Stow, OH

Hours:
Monday – Friday: 8AM – 12PM

SparkJoy ABA, in partnership with Finni Health, is seeking a compassionate, Behavior Technician to provide in-home ABA therapy to a child with autism in Stow, OH. Nepali-speaking candidates strongly encouraged to apply—we value professionals who can serve their own community and assist with translation when needed.

Why Join Us?

We’re a mission-driven, clinician-led company focused on ethical care and meaningful outcomes—not investor pressure. Enjoy free advanced training, ongoing BCBA support, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact in a child’s life.

Your Role:

  • Work 1:1 with a child in-home using individualized ABA treatment plans

  • Teach communication, daily living, and social skills

  • Collect data and collaborate closely with supervising BCBAs

  • Support families through parent training and consistent communication

  • Translate and support the family in their native language when appropriate

Work Environment: This job operates in a client’s home. Candidates must be comfortable entering homes and neighborhoods within the assigned area.

What You Bring:

  • 1+ year of experience working with children with autism or developmental disabilities (preferred)

  • Experience in early intervention (ages 2–6)

  • Current CPR certification (preferred)

  • Strong communication, time management, and organizational skills

  • A passion for helping children grow and succeed

  • Reliable transportation to client homes in Akron

  • Fluency in Nepali and willingness to translate as needed

Job Details:

  • Part-time: ~20 hours/week, potential for full-time as well

  • Schedule: Monday–Friday, 8AM–12PM

  • Pay: $17–$22/hour (direct)

  • Location: In-home (Stow, OH)

  • Benefits: PTO, professional development opportunities

Join a Company That Values People Over Profit

At SparkJoy ABA, we're changing lives—one session at a time. Apply today to make a meaningful difference while serving your community.

Note: A background check is required. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, pending satisfactory screening results.

jobs.title: Autism Behavior Technician (RBT) - Phoenix, AZ
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Finni is looking for a Full-time BT/RBT!

As a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing ABA care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting and community

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Be available weekly for supervision by the Behavior Analyst

  • Attend team meetings

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Sick Days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within the field

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Must have an active CPR Certification

  • Must be willing to become RBT certified within specific time frame

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are At Finni Health

Finni Health empowers BCBAs to launch local in-home ABA clinics. We are bringing together world-class therapists, marketers and technology enthusiasts to build the future of autism care. Help join us change the modality of care together!

Job Type: Part-time, Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance

  • Health insurance

  • Paid time off

  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

  • Are you located within a 45 minute commute of X, TN?

  • Are you available to work part-time, M-F, starting at 3pm?

License/Certification:

  • CPR Certification (Required)

  • RBT Certification (Preferred)

#FinniHealth2025

Work Location: In person

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
Open Doors ABA
Part-time | Hendersonville & Springfield, TN | M-F 3:30pm–7:30pm (15–20 hrs/week)

Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of children with autism and looking for a rewarding career in ABA therapy? Open Doors ABA is seeking dedicated Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) to join our supportive and collaborative team!

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay: $23.50–$25.00/hr for direct hours

  • Flexible, part-time schedule: Monday–Friday, 3:30pm–7:30pm (15–20 hours per week)

  • Supervision and mentorship toward BCBA/BCaBA certification

  • Health insurance and ongoing professional development opportunities

  • Supportive, team-oriented environment focused on growth and success

About the Role

As an RBT with Open Doors ABA, you’ll provide compassionate, evidence-based behavior therapy to children and families in the Hendersonville and Springfield areas. You’ll work directly under the supervision of a BCBA, implementing individualized treatment plans that make a lasting impact.

Key Responsibilities

  • Implement ABA treatment plans developed and supervised by a BCBA

  • Collect and record accurate data on client progress

  • Engage children in structured, play-based learning activities

  • Collaborate with team members and communicate effectively with families

  • Maintain professionalism, confidentiality, and a positive attitude

Qualifications

  • Current RBT certification (required)

  • Reliable transportation between Hendersonville and Springfield

  • Passionate, dependable, and committed to helping children reach their goals

  • Ability to work weekday afternoons/evenings

Why Join Open Doors ABA?

We’re more than a workplace — we’re a team that values your dedication, supports your career development, and celebrates your impact. Our mission is to open doors to brighter futures for the children and families we serve — and for our staff, too.

How to Apply

If you’re ready to grow your career in a supportive, mission-driven environment, apply today to join Open Doors ABA!

Job Type: Part-time
Pay: $23.50–$25.00/hr (direct) |
Schedule: Monday–Friday, 3:30pm–7:30pm (15–20 hours/week)
Work Locations: Hendersonville & Springfield, TN

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, pending satisfactory screening results.

 - Collect data and collaborate with supervising BCBAs

 - Support families through parent training and consistent communication

 - Work Environment - This job operates in a client's home environment. Employees must feel comfortable going into client homes and neighborhoods within the assigned territory.

What You Bring:

 - 1+ year experience with children with autism or developmental disabilities

 - Strong communication, time management, and organizational skills

 - A passion for helping children grow and succeed

 - Reliable transportation to client homes in Wadsworth

Job Details:

 - Part-time: 25 hours/week

 - Pay: $17–$22/hr

 - Benefits: PTO, professional development

Join a company that values people over profit. SparkJoy ABA is changing lives—one session at a time.

Apply today and spark joy in a child’s life.

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.


#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Remote Board Certified Behavior Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Remote BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) – Tennessee LBA
KB Behavioral Health | Powered by Finni Health
Make an Impact. Work Flexibly. Grow with Us.

About the Role:
KB Behavioral Health is seeking a passionate and dedicated Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) with an active Tennessee LBA license to join our growing team. Part-time hours available, Monday-Friday.

This is a remote, flexible position where you’ll provide high-quality, individualized ABA services to children with autism and developmental disabilities—backed by a collaborative and supportive clinical team.

Responsibilities:
- Conduct diagnostic evaluations and assessments of patients with developmental disabilities and autism
- Develop and implement individualized behavior intervention plans
- Provide behavioral therapy and support to patients
- Monitor and evaluate patient progress, adjusting treatment plans as necessary
- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure comprehensive care for patients
- Maintain accurate and confidential medical documentation in compliance with HIPAA regulations
- Stay up-to-date with current research and best practices in behavioral health

Skills:

- Experience working with children and individuals with developmental disabilities or autism
- Strong knowledge of behavioral assessment techniques and interventions
- Ability to conduct diagnostic evaluations and develop individualized treatment plans
- Proficient in behavioral therapy techniques and strategies
- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
- Strong interpersonal skills for working with patients, families, and interdisciplinary teams
- Attention to detail and ability to maintain accurate medical documentation

Job Types: Part-time

Pay: $50.00 - $65.00 per hour

Expected hours: 5 – 25 per week

Benefits:

  • Paid time off

  • Professional development assistance

  • Referral program

Schedule:

  • Day shift

  • Morning shift

  • Monday to Friday

License/Certification:

  • TN LBA (Required)

Work Location: Remote

#FinniHealth2025

jobs.title: Daytime Behavior Technician (RBT) - Epping, NH
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Are you looking to make a difference in a child with autisms life? If so, apply to join our team! We have a part-time role open in the Epping area!

As a Behavior Technician you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Work closely with BCBAs and help build the best treatment plans

  • Attend team meetings as designated to share your weekly experience, collaborate with other team members and provide feedback for how we can improve

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Mental Health days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within child care

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Proof of completion of a 40-hour Behavior Technician training course

  • Pass RBT Certification within 90 days of hire (we will help you study)

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are at Finni Health

We believe in making therapy a fun and enjoyable experience for kiddos. Our highly trained therapists use creative and engaging activities tailored to your child's interests, turning each session into an exciting adventure. We celebrate every achievement along the way, providing positive reinforcement to motivate and build confidence.

We meticulously personalize care because we understand that each child is unique. We work closely with families to set individual goals and track progress, making adjustments whenever needed. Together, we create a supportive and nurturing environment where your child can thrive and develop vital skills.

Job Types: Part-time

Schedule: Monday-Friday 8am-1pm

Pay: $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

  • Paid time off

  • Professional development assistance

  • Referral program

Schedule:

  • After school

  • Day shift

Experience:

  • Applied behavior analysis: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

#FinniHealth2025

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Part-Time Early Childhood Autism Behavior Therapist / Registered Behavior Technician RBT - Carpentersville, IL
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location: Carpentersville, IL

Compensation: $18.00 - $24.00/hour (Weekdays: 12-6:30 pm, Saturday and Sunday 9 am -1pm)

Schedule: Part-time, less than 30 hours per week

Work Environment: In-Home Setting (Client home) and School-based

Job description

Finni is urgently looking for ABA Therapists looking to become Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) to work in Mundelein, IL and the surrounding area!

BCBA or BCaBA practicum students are highly encouraged to apply!!

As an ABA Therapist/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst to implement life-changing ABA care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting and in the community, such as a daycare setting

  • Collect and record data on therapy goals

  • Receive weekly supervision from a doctorate-level Behavior Analyst

  • Attend team meetings and trainings as scheduled by your supervisor


What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Sick Days (full-time staff)

  • Mileage and Drive-Time reimbursement

  • Weekly supervision from your BCBA

  • BCBA and BCaBA fieldwork experience

  • Values and Culture Driven Leadership


What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within the field

  • Experience working with children (early intervention), and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Experience with high-aggression clients (e.g. teens with severe behaviors)

  • Reliable Transportation

  • A think outside of the box personality to make therapy fun for your clients

  • Professional social skills to interact with and support caregivers

  • Active RBT Certification (Preferred, but will train if needed)

  • Active CPR Certification (Required, but will train if needed)

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening


Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time


Who We Are At Finni Health

We are bringing together world-class therapists, marketers and technology enthusiasts to build the future of autism care. Help join us change the modality of care together!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.00 - $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 - 25 hours per week

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

  • Mileage reimbursement

  • Paid time off

  • Paid training

  • Referral program

  • Vision insurance

License/Certification:

  • CPR Certification (Preferred)

  • RBT Certification (Preferred)

Experience:

  • ABA: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

JOB DESCRIPTION

Finni is urgently looking for ABA Therapists looking to become Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) to work in Mundelein, IL and the surrounding area!

BCBA or BCaBA practicum students are highly encouraged to apply!!

As an ABA Therapist/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst to implement life-changing ABA care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

 - Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting and in the community, such as a daycare setting

 - Collect and record data on therapy goals

 - Receive weekly supervision from a doctorate-level Behavior Analyst

 - Attend team meetings and trainings as scheduled by your supervisor



WHAT WE OFFER

 - Competitive pay and paid training

 - Career Growth & flexible hours

 - PTO and Sick Days (full-time staff)

 - Mileage and Drive-Time reimbursement

 - Weekly supervision from your BCBA

 - BCBA and BCaBA fieldwork experience

 - Values and Culture Driven Leadership



WHAT YOU'LL NEED

 - Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within the field

 - Experience working with children (early intervention), and a passion for working with children with special needs

 - Experience with high-aggression clients (e.g. teens with severe behaviors)

 - Reliable Transportation

 - A think outside of the box personality to make therapy fun for your clients

 - Professional social skills to interact with and support caregivers

 - Active RBT Certification (Preferred, but will train if needed)

 - Active CPR Certification (Required, but will train if needed)

 - To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

 - Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

 - Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

 - Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

jobs.title: Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Are you looking to make a difference in a child with autisms life? If so, apply to join our team! We have part-time and full-time roles open in the Boise area!

As a Behavior Technician you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Work closely with BCBAs and help build the best treatment plans

  • Attend team meetings as designated to share your weekly experience, collaborate with other team members and provide feedback for how we can improve

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Mental Health days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within child care

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Proof of completion of a 40-hour Behavior Technician training course

  • Pass RBT Certification within 90 days of hire (we will help you study)

  • To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are at Finni Health

We believe in making therapy a fun and enjoyable experience for kiddos. Our highly trained therapists use creative and engaging activities tailored to your child's interests, turning each session into an exciting adventure. We celebrate every achievement along the way, providing positive reinforcement to motivate and build confidence.

We meticulously personalize care because we understand that each child is unique. We work closely with families to set individual goals and track progress, making adjustments whenever needed. Together, we create a supportive and nurturing environment where your child can thrive and develop vital skills.

Job Types: Full-time, part-time

Pay: $18.00 - $25.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Morning or afternoon availability

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Applied behavior analysis: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In home

#FinniHealth2025

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

Pay: $18.00 - $25.00 per hour

Schedule:

 - Morning or afternoon availability

 - Monday to Friday

Experience:

 - Applied behavior analysis: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In home

#FinniHealth2025

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Finni is looking for a Full-time BT/RBT!

As a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) you will work with our Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement life-changing ABA care in-home. You’ll work one-on-one with our patient's families, helping children learn new skills and reach new milestones.

  • Provide in-person behavior intervention services in a child’s home setting and community

  • Collect and record data on child behaviors

  • Be available weekly for supervision by the Behavior Analyst

  • Attend team meetings

What We Offer

  • Competitive pay and paid training

  • Career Growth & flexible hours

  • PTO and Sick Days

  • Mileage reimbursement

What You'll Need

  • Minimum high-school degree or equivalent - ideally looking for candidates interested in pursuing careers within the field

  • Experience working with children, and a passion for working with children with special needs

  • Reliable Transportation

  • Must have an active CPR Certification

  • Must be willing to become RBT certified within specific time frame

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time

  • Sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time

Who We Are At Finni Health

Finni Health empowers BCBAs to launch local in-home ABA clinics. We are bringing together world-class therapists, marketers and technology enthusiasts to build the future of autism care. Help join us change the modality of care together!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $21.00 - $27.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance

  • Health insurance

  • Paid time off

  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

  • Are you available to work full-time, M-F, starting at 8:30 to 6:00?

License/Certification:

  • CPR Certification (Required)

  • RBT Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In Home, Other

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.

jobs.title: Behavior Technician/ Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Bilingual (Spanish/English) Behavior Technician (Part-Time) – Cleveland, OH 44102
Hours:

  • 12-15 hours per week

SparkJoy ABA, in partnership with Finni Health, is seeking a compassionate and motivated Behavior Technician to provide in-home ABA therapy to children with autism in Cleveland, OH.

Why Join Us?
We’re a mission-driven, clinician-led company focused on ethical care and meaningful outcomes—not investor pressure. Enjoy free advanced training, ongoing BCBA support, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact.

Your Role:

  • Work 1:1 with children in-home using individualized ABA treatment plans

  • Teach communication, daily living, and social skills

  • Collect data and collaborate with supervising BCBAs

  • Support families through parent training and consistent communication

  • Work Environment - This job operates in a client's home environment. Employees must feel comfortable going into client homes and neighborhoods within the assigned territory.

What You Bring:

  • 1+ year experience with children with autism or developmental disabilities

  • Strong communication, time management, and organizational skills

  • A passion for helping children grow and succeed

  • Reliable transportation to client homes in Cleveland

Job Details:

  • Part-time: 12-15 hours/week

  • Pay: $17–$22/hr

  • Benefits: PTO, professional development

Join a company that values people over profit. SparkJoy ABA is changing lives—one session at a time.

Apply today and spark joy in a child’s life.

#FinniHealth2025

To protect our clients and their families, this position requires a background check. Successful candidates will receive a conditional offer of employment, with a final confirmation to start pending the satisfactory results of the screening.
